question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, unambiguous, and made publicly by Biden or his campaign, leaving no possibility of him accepting the nomination for the 2024 election.

Given this, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM? Resolves YES if it is >46.6% at that time, and NO otherwise.

This analysis considers the impact of Biden's decision on Harris's perceived chances in the model, as tracked on Nate Silver's platform.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden declare that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's chances of victory improve according to Nate Silver's projections?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: Joe Biden publicly states before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This declaration must be clear, unequivocal, and made by Biden or his campaign, eliminating any chance of him running for the 2024 election.

In light of this, will Kamala Harris's likelihood of winning in the Electoral College, as per Nate Silver's projections, exceed 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM? The resolution is YES if it is greater than 46.6% at that moment, and NO otherwise.

This evaluation examines how Biden's choice influences Harris's estimated probabilities in the model, as monitored on Nate Silver's platform.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden declare he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will the likelihood of Kamala Harris winning rise according to Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: Joe Biden publicly states before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This statement must be clear, unequivocal, and announced by Biden or his campaign, eliminating any chance of him accepting the nomination for the 2024 election.

In light of this, will Kamala Harris's probability of securing Electoral College votes in Nate Silver's model exceed 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM? The outcome is YES if it is greater than 46.6% at that specific time, and NO otherwise.

This evaluation examines how Biden's choice influences Harris's perceived chances in the model, as monitored on Nate Silver's platform.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden announces that he will not run for the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's chances of winning increase based on Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
Consider this scenario: Joe Biden makes a clear announcement before July 15, 2024, that he will not be pursuing the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This declaration must be definitive, made by Biden or his campaign, ensuring that he cannot be nominated for the 2024 election.

Given this situation, will the likelihood of Kamala Harris obtaining Electoral College votes in Nate Silver's model surpass 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM? The answer is YES if it exceeds 46.6% at that exact time, and NO if it does not.

This analysis explores how Biden's decision affects the perceived probability of Harris's success in the model as tracked on Nate Silver's platform.

question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. (b) Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or prevented from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media sources. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may take place *after* the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Donald Trump could be barred or stopped from being on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially barred or stopped from being on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The barring or stopping is confirmed through official announcements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or reliable media outlets. Speculative information, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will be answered with "No" if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It strictly examines whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the given criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred or stopped from a ballot but later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not barred or stopped from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is removed or blocked from a primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will he be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024. This removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, and is not reversed by that date.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution is based on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the eventual outcome of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump is disqualified or prevented from appearing on a primary ballot due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will he still become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or prevented from being on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024. This disqualification or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news sources, and must not be overturned by that date.

Then, can it be said that Donald Trump will be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The determination is contingent upon the choices made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the final result of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump is disqualified or barred from participating in the primary election due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will he still secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, effective July 15, 2024. This disqualification or barring must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news sources, and cannot be undone by that date.

Then, can it be affirmed that Donald Trump will be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The determination hinges on the choices made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of the final results of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: In the event that Donald Trump is disqualified or prevented from running in the primary election due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will he still obtain the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Given the following scenario: Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, effective July 15, 2024. This disqualification or prevention must be confirmed through official announcements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documentation, or trustworthy news outlets, and cannot be reversed by that date.

Then, can it be confirmed that Donald Trump will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The outcome depends on the decisions made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the final outcome of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (2) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. Note that the question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (1) Donald Trump is either removed or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (2) Donald Trump becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if both of the subsequent conditions are satisfied:

1. By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or credible media sources. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial declarations will not be sufficient for resolution. It is important to note that this question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the defined criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or barred from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being removed or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

2. Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election. The identity of the individual who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 U.S. election is irrelevant; the determination is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not fulfilled.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following two events to happen: (1) Donald Trump gets disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (2) Donald Trump becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election?

If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

2. Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election. The identity of the individual who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 U.S. election is irrelevant; the determination is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

The question will be answered with "No" if either or both of these criteria are not satisfied.

para_P.title: Can the following two scenarios occur simultaneously: (1) Donald Trump is barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (2) Donald Trump secures the Republican nomination for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election?

This question will yield a "Yes" response if both of the following conditions are met:

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Joe Biden dies before Saturday, will he remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden dies before Saturday, with an official announcement of his death made before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden pass away prior to Saturday, will he still hold the office of President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario is accurate: Joe Biden passes away before Saturday, with an official declaration of his death issued before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. 

Criteria for resolving the condition: Resolves YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden continues to be the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (The Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

If the condition is not satisfied, resolves N/A.

A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (The Acting President is distinct from the President as per the Constitution)

If the condition is not satisfied, it resolves to N/A.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.body:

Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are still quite concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 members of the House or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also suffice to resolve this market to YES.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market's closing time, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five named Democratic House Representatives or Senators press Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local media that they no longer believe Biden can win in November.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more hectic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one is intended to urge Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with these activities.

This market will resolve to YES if a collective of at least five named Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators collaborate to ask Joe Biden to reflect on ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter as mentioned above, or through another method such as a group meeting with Biden in person and jointly requesting him to withdraw.

This market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same unified message. If five individuals independently express to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw, it will not be sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden with a request for him to step aside will not meet this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's closing date. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond reasonable doubt, the market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, the market will resolve to NO.

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

Reports of unnamed Democrats will not fulfill this requirement unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the deadline. (b) Joe Biden or his campaign must issue a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election. The announcement must be unequivocal and final, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a declaration is not made before the cutoff, this condition will resolve to NO.

This overall inquiry resolves to YES if both (a) and (b) take place as outlined above.

para_P.title: Could the following two scenarios occur: (a) A group of no fewer than five designated Democratic House Representatives or US Senators call on Biden to step back from the race prior to July 20th, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) A group consisting of at least five specified Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators must come together to urge Joe Biden to consider halting his 2024 re-election campaign, or to pressure him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This can be done through a signed letter or another means, such as a face-to-face conversation with Biden. All five individuals must be involved in the same communication. Reports mentioning unnamed Democrats will not meet this requirement unless at least five qualifying names are revealed before the deadline. If these conditions are not met, this requirement will result in NO.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign must provide a clear, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election. The statement must be definitive and conclusive, leaving no room for Biden to accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this requirement will result in NO.

This overall question will resolve to YES if both (a) and (b) occur as specified.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Should Ireland reach the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Luxembourg also qualify?
para_P.body:
Given that the following is true: Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In this scenario, will Luxembourg also achieve qualification for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024? 

Criteria for resolution: 
- For Ireland, it is deemed true if Ireland qualifies for the Grand Final as acknowledged by EBU.
- For Luxembourg, it is deemed true if Luxembourg qualifies for the Grand Final as acknowledged by EBU. If Luxembourg does not qualify, it is regarded as false.

question.title: Will both Ireland and Luxembourg qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Luxembourg participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Ireland and Luxembourg set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Ireland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Luxembourg takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the EBU as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not secure a spot, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

para_P.title: Are Ireland and Luxembourg both set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both of the following conditions are satisfied: (a) Ireland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Luxembourg participates in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the EBU as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both fail to qualify, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

para_P.title: Will both Ireland and Luxembourg qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will result in a **Yes** if the following two criteria are met: (a) Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Luxembourg competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the EBU as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not qualify, the question will result in a **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian control over the area

question.title: Given Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under Russian control according to categories such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories indicating Russian control. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a statement is not made by then, this question will resolve as No.

para_P.title: If Russia maintains control over Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024, will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E are under Russian control, based on classifications such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other classifications that signify Russian dominance. Then, will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Criteria for determining the outcome: This inquiry will be resolved as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be clear and definitive. If such an announcement is not made by that time, this question will be resolved as No.

para_P.title: If Russia maintains control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?

Then, will Joe Biden make an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

Criteria for determining the outcome: This question will be resolved as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive. If such a declaration is not made by that time, this question will resolve as No.

para_P.title: Should Russia still have control over Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Given that on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E are under the control of Russia, based on classifications such as Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine, Evaluated Russian Gains in the Last 24 Hours, Confirmed Russian Authority, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other indicators that reflect Russian control. Will Joe Biden make a public statement before July 15, 2024, declaring that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Criteria for determining the outcome: This question will be answered with Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign releases a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not seek nor accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unequivocal. If such a statement is not made by that deadline, this question will be answered as No.

question.title: Will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories indicating Russian control:
   - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
   - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Assessed Russian Control
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

   The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
   - Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
   - Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

2. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as Yes.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's death prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be deemed a NO.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden pass away prior to Saturday?

Resolves YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th.

question.title: Given Joe Biden dies before Saturday, will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden dies before Saturday. This means there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Then, is it true that the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will be a woman? This resolves “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday, will the nominee for the 2024 Democratic Presidential election be a female?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden passes away before Saturday. This implies there will be an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th. Then, is it accurate to say that the nominee for the 2024 Democratic Presidential election will be a female? This will be considered “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates choose a woman as the presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and “no” if/when the Democratic delegates choose a man as the presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

This would be “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female candidate for the 2024 election, and “no” if/when the Democratic delegates choose a male candidate for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday (b) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a Woman?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.
(b) Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following happen: (a) Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday (b) The Democratic Party's nominee for President in 2024 is a woman?
para_P.body:
(a) Will be considered YES if there is a formal announcement regarding Joe Biden's death before the markets close on Friday, July 26th. If not, it will be deemed NO.
(b) Will be marked as “yes” if and when the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential nomination in 2024. It will be marked as “no” if and when a male candidate is selected by the Democratic delegates for the presidential nomination in 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday (b) A Woman is chosen as the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered YES if there is an official confirmation of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th. If not, it will be considered NO.
(b) This will be deemed “yes” if and when the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential nomination in the 2024 election. It will be deemed “no” if and when the Democratic delegates choose a male candidate for the presidential nomination in the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Can both of the following scenarios occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday (b) A female candidate is selected as the Democratic Presidential Nominee for 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if there is official confirmation of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. If not, it will be marked as NO.
(b) This will be considered “yes” if the Democratic delegates opt for a woman as their candidate for the presidential nomination in the 2024 election. It will be considered “no” if the Democratic delegates select a man as their candidate for the presidential nomination in the 2024 election.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the chosen candidate for the Republican party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Vivek Ramaswamy going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. Additional candidates may be included in the future beyond those currently mentioned.

For this inquiry, the identity of the Republican nominee on the date of the 2024 US election is not pertinent; the outcome is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention to represent the party in the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other nominees will be considered a **No**. There may be additional candidates introduced in the future beyond those currently listed.

For the purpose of this question, the identity of the Republican candidate on the date of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the determination is solely based on who is elected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is not influenced by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024?

para_P.title: If Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump face charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is independent of who gets the Republican nomination on election day in 2024; it is determined only by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Is it accurate to state that Donald Trump will be charged or indicted for any remarks concerning potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024?

para_P.title: If Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump face charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is independent of who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it accurate to say that Donald Trump will be charged or indicted for any comments regarding potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024?

para_P.title: Should Vivek Ramaswamy secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump be indicted for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is true: Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This choice is separate from who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely decided by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, can it be stated that Donald Trump will face charges or an indictment regarding any remarks he made about possible witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* prior to June 1, 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (2) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(1) Vivek Ramaswamy will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(2) Donald Trump will be charged with witness tampering in Georgia if he is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in 'The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al'. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (2) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) Vivek Ramaswamy will become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if the Republican National Convention selects him as their nominee. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is the nominee on election day in 2024.

(2) Donald Trump will be charged with witness tampering in Georgia if he faces charges or is indicted regarding any statements about potential witnesses in 'The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al'. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to take place: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (2) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) Vivek Ramaswamy will become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their nominee. This choice is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is the nominee on election day in 2024.

Then, will 'Deadpool & Wolverine' have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie? Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie. The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will the Republicans retain Ohio's 6th district in 2024?

This announcement must be definitive, public, and official, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle. Given this scenario, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election? This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. question.title: Conditional on Vivek Ramaswamy being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite credible media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that time.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This question resolves to YES if Biden continues to be the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden remain in office as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will result in a YES if Biden remains the President of the United States through the end of July 2024 (ET); it will yield a NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President prior to that date.

A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (like designating his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES outcome. (The position of Acting President is separate from that of President under the Constitution)

question.title: If Biden remains President through July 2024, will Trump be removed from any state ballot under 14th Amendment Section 3?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden remains the President of the United States through the end of July 2024. This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not affect this status.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The resolution is "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question strictly pertains to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not consider legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after this date. If Trump is removed or blocked and then reinstated such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Should Biden continue as President until the end of July 2024, will Trump face disqualification from any state ballot due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden continues to serve as the President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024. This implies he neither resigns, passes away, nor otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th Amendment, which appoints his Vice President as the Acting President, does not change this situation.

Then, can we assert that Donald Trump will be disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This will be considered "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position according to the stipulations of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. The answer will be "No" if these circumstances are not fulfilled as of July 15, 2024. Note: The inquiry strictly relates to the situation as of July 15, 2024, and does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals after this date. If Trump is disqualified or barred and then reinstated such that he is not disqualified or barred as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Should Biden still be in office by the end of July 2024, will Trump be disqualified from any state ballot according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden continues as the President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024, meaning he does not resign, pass away, or otherwise stop being President prior to that time. A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th Amendment, which appoints his Vice President as the Acting President, does not alter this situation.

In that case, can we affirm that Donald Trump will be prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? The answer will be "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position under the provisions of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as verified by official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal records, or reliable media sources. The answer will be "No" if these stipulations are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024. Note: This inquiry strictly concerns the situation as of July 15, 2024, and does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals after this date. If Trump is disqualified or barred but then reinstated so that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or barred, the answer will be negative.

para_P.title: Will Trump be barred from any state ballot if Biden remains in office until the end of July 2024 according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
If we consider the premise that Joe Biden remains the President of the United States until the end of July 2024, implying he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before that date, and that any temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment, designating his Vice President as Acting President, does not change this scenario.

Then, can we conclude that Donald Trump will be disqualified from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? The response will be "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as confirmed by official statements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or trustworthy news outlets. Conversely, the answer will be "No" if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024. It is important to note that this question specifically pertains to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not consider any legal challenges, appeals, or subsequent changes after this date. If Trump is disqualified or barred but later reinstated so that he is not disqualified or barred as of July 15, the answer will be negative.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024, and will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

Both conditions must be met for this question to resolve as "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to be President until the end of July 2024, and will Donald Trump be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with "Yes" if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. Biden stays in office as President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET). This will be answered with "No" if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) will not lead to a "Yes" resolution, as the Acting President is not the same as the President under the Constitution.

2. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from being on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or credible media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution. The question will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024. Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may occur after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

Both criteria must be satisfied for this question to resolve as "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Biden stay in office until the end of July 2024, and will Donald Trump be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered "Yes" if the following two criteria are satisfied:

1. Biden continues to serve as President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET). This will be marked as NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary handover of authority under the 25th amendment (i.e., designating his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES answer. (An Acting President is distinct from a President as defined by the Constitution).

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from being on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or prevention must be corroborated by official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution. The question will be answered "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may happen after the specified date. It solely addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the specified criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot but later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the answer will be negative.

Both criteria must be fulfilled for this question to be answered "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in his position until the end of July 2024, and will Donald Trump be barred or stopped from appearing on the primary election ballot in any state within the U.S. for a federal role according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a "Yes" answer if the following two conditions are met:

1. Biden remains in his role as President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (Eastern Time). This will be marked as "No" if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before that date. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment (i.e., designating his Vice President as Acting President) does not constitute a "Yes" response. (An Acting President is different from a President as defined by the Constitution).

2. By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially barred or stopped from being on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This barring or stopping must be supported by official announcements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or reputable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial comments will not suffice for a resolution. The question will be answered "No" if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024. Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may occur after the specified date. It solely addresses whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal role based on the specified criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred or stopped from a ballot but later reinstated, leading to him not being barred or stopped from any ballot as of July 15th, the answer will be negative.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to receive a "Yes" answer.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared the imposition of new tariffs or duties applicable to the import of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the European Union will declare new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared the imposition of new tariffs or duties that would affect the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Could the European Union impose new tariffs or duties on the importation of electric vehicles from China before July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced the establishment of new tariffs or duties that would impact the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU before July 5, 2024.

question.title: Given the EU announces new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024, will at least 5 Dem House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the potential link between two political events. Suppose the following is true: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles. Given this scenario, is it true that a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators will work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For the outcome to resolve as YES:
- The EU must announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024.
- At least five named Democratic House Members or Senators must collectively pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, through a group action, such as signing a letter or a collective in-person request.

If either of these conditions is not met, the question resolves NO.

para_P.title: If the EU implements new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, will a minimum of five Democratic Members of the House or Senate exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the possible connection between two political occurrences. Assume the following holds true: Before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has put forth new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles. Given this situation, is it accurate to say that a coalition of at least five specified Democratic Party members from the US House or US Senate will collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ceasing his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For the answer to be YES:
- The EU must unveil new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles ahead of July 5, 2024.
- A group of at least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators must jointly pressure Biden to withdraw before July 20, 2024, through a collective action, such as signing a letter or making a group in-person appeal.

If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, the resolution will be NO.

para_P.title: If the EU implements new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, will a minimum of five Democratic House Representatives or Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the possible connection between two political occurrences. In light of this situation, is it accurate that a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party members from the US House or US Senators will collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ceasing his 2024 presidential campaign, or will encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?
