- The EU must implement new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024.
- A minimum of five identified Democratic House Members or Senators must jointly apply pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20, 2024, through a collective action, such as signing a letter or making a unified in-person appeal.

If either of these criteria is not satisfied, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Should the European Union impose new tariffs on electric vehicles from China before July 5, 2024, will at least five Democratic members of the House or Senate push Biden to exit the race prior to July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question explores the potential relationship between two political events. Assume the following is true: Prior to July 5, 2024, credible reports suggest that the European Union (EU) has introduced new tariffs or duties on the importation of electric vehicles from China. Given this scenario, is it true that a group of no fewer than five specified Democratic Party members from the US House or Senate will work together to urge Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 presidential campaign, or will motivate him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For the outcome to be YES:
- The EU must impose new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024.
- At least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators must collectively pressure Biden to withdraw before July 20, 2024, through a united action, such as signing a letter or making a coordinated in-person request.

If either of these conditions is not met, the question will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (2) at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(1) The first condition will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) The second condition will resolve as **Yes** if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter, as reported, or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (1) the EU will declare new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, and (2) at least five specific Democratic House Members or Senators will pressure Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) The first condition will be considered **Yes** if, by July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding the implementation of new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) The second condition will be deemed **Yes** if a minimum of five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate halting his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could involve signing a letter, as reported, or engaging in another format such as a group discussion with Biden in person, collectively urging him to withdraw. All five individuals must be part of the same collective message. If five individuals each separately express to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw, this will not suffice for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats communicating with Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet the criteria for this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's conclusion. In cases of ambiguity regarding such names being reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards resolving NO. If these stipulations are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (1) the EU to declare new tariffs on electric vehicles from China prior to July 5, 2024, and (2) a minimum of 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators to pressure Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) The first condition will be deemed **Yes** if, by July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding the implementation of new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) The second condition will be considered **Yes** if a collective of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to urge Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to press him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could occur through the signing of a letter, as reported, or via another method such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively request his withdrawal. All five individuals must be part of the same group communication. If five individuals separately express to reporters their belief that Biden should step down, this will not suffice for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden asking him to step aside will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least 5 qualifying names are disclosed before the conclusion of this market. In cases of ambiguity where such names are reported but not confirmed with reasonable certainty, this market will default to resolving NO. If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

para_P.title: Could it happen that both of the following events occur: (1) the EU imposes new tariffs on electric vehicles imported from China before July 5, 2024, and (2) at least 5 specific Democratic House Members or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) The first condition will be marked as **Yes** if, by July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has declared new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) The second condition will be deemed **Yes** if a group of no fewer than five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to persuade Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to compel him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could happen through a signed letter, as reported, or through another means such as a face-to-face meeting with Biden to collectively urge his withdrawal. All five individuals must be part of the same group communication. If five individuals independently communicate to reporters their opinion that Biden should resign, this will not be enough for a YES outcome. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats contacting Biden to ask him to step aside will not fulfill the criteria of this market unless at least 5 qualifying names are revealed before this market concludes. In situations where there is uncertainty regarding such names being reported but not confirmed with reasonable certainty, this market will default to a NO resolution. If these conditions are not met before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will determine a “Yes” outcome if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a higher likelihood of winning than Joe Biden on that same date. In the event that both candidates are shown to have equal probabilities, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically utilizing the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations to the methods used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate these figures will not affect the resolution of this market.

The market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is available. It may not resolve until the datapoints for July 20 are released. If there are no available datapoints for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve according to the closest previous figures available prior to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution refers to the winning odds of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

In the event that both candidates have equal probabilities, this market will resolve at 50-50.

The determining source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the figures indicated by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date of this market. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate its data will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. The market may remain unresolved until the July 20 data becomes available. Please note that the resolution pertains to the probabilities of each candidate winning expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate won will not be taken into account.

question.title: Given 538 projects Biden as the favorite on Friday, will Kamala Harris’ VP pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected by FiveThirtyEight to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump, as indicated by the blue trend line on the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast. This is based on the data available for July 19, with the resolution occurring as soon as July 20 data is available, or by July 22 if July 19 data is missing.

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris will announce her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, 2024? This resolves YES if Kamala Harris confirms either Kelly or Shapiro as her VP pick, and NO if she confirms anyone else.

The resolution criterion for the condition is based on FiveThirtyEight's data, while the outcome is based on Kamala Harris' announcement.

question.body:

If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will there be an announcement from Joe Biden before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement declaring that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will there be an announcement from Joe Biden before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:

For a **Yes** outcome, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body:

For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should remove any chance that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election.

If such a definitive declaration is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the figure recorded for that date shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, resulting in a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.body:

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value was Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which corresponds to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

In this scenario, a positive number reflects Trump's lead, while a negative number indicates Biden is ahead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the recorded figure showed Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 relevant to this inquiry.

question.title: Conditional on Kamala Harris becoming President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This determination will be based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Then, is the following true? Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves YES if he remains President, and NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

para_P.title: If Kamala Harris is designated as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, will Biden still be in office until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:

This conclusion will rely on verified information from the US government or a consensus of reliable news sources.

Under these circumstances, is it accurate to say that Joe Biden continues to serve as US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET)? This is a YES if he remains in office, and a NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. It is important to note that a temporary power shift under the 25th amendment, which appoints his Vice President as Acting President, does not result in a YES outcome, as the roles of Acting President and President are distinct according to the Constitution.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he receive at least a 3% increase in support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a standard Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion regularly indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump by a margin greater than the margin of error, while every other Democrat tested in these hypothetical scenarios either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants indicative of the broader electorate?

This market will resolve to YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more when both polls are closed.

To calculate Trump's vote percentage, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Others)). The answer is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve to N/A, and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll presents a hypothetical ballot featuring Joe Biden, while the other features a generic Democrat.

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump outside the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat included in hypothetical scenarios tends to lead or fall within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader population?

This market will conclude with a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

To calculate Trump's vote percentage, the equation used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES will be determined if the result of this formula for poll 1 minus that for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never result in N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

Two polls from Manifold are accessible, both ending on July 6. One poll includes a hypothetical ballot with Joe Biden, while the other features a standard Democrat.

Public opinion polls often show Joe Biden lagging behind Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, while other Democrats in hypothetical situations typically either lead or are within the margin of error. Do the Manifold participants accurately represent the larger population?

To compute Trump's vote share, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES will be determined if the difference between the results of this formula for poll 1 and poll 2 is 0.03 or more. If not, the response will be NO.

The polls and this question will never lead to N/A and will remain open until the specified closing time regardless of any situations.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 3 but no more than 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will determine if Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden by a margin greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4 according to 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:

In this scenario, a positive number signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates that Biden is in front. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure showed Trump was 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which represents a positive value of 2.4 in the context of this inquiry.

para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered as Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. (b) This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other potential candidates will be answered as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be included later. For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.body:

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if a debate occurs among the potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO in all other cases.

para_P.title: Is another debate for the Democratic party's presidential candidates expected?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if a debate occurs among prospective Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO if no such debate takes place.

para_P.title: Can we anticipate an additional debate among the Democratic party's presidential hopefuls?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if a debate takes place among potential Democratic candidates (including Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO if no such debate occurs.

question.title: Conditional on there being another Democratic party presidential debate, if Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Given this, if President Joe Biden drops out, will a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is a debate as described. Resolves NO otherwise.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the media coverage condition is met. Resolves NO if Biden drops out but the condition is not met. Resolves N/A if Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: If there is another debate for the Democratic party presidential candidates, will a reputable news organization report on Joe Biden's withdrawal at least 6 hours prior to his official announcement?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: There is a debate among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) leading up to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. In this context, if President Joe Biden decides to withdraw, will a major and trustworthy news organization like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provide coverage of his withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before Biden makes his official announcement through a letter, speech, etc.?

Criteria for resolving the condition: Resolves to YES if the debate occurs as described. Resolves to NO if it does not. 
Criteria for resolving the outcome: Resolves to YES if the media coverage condition is satisfied. Resolves to NO if Biden withdraws but the condition is not satisfied. Resolves to N/A if Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: If there is another Democratic presidential debate, will a trustworthy media organization report on Joe Biden's withdrawal at least 6 hours prior, assuming he decides to exit?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario is accurate: A debate is held among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. In this context, if President Joe Biden chooses to withdraw, will a major and credible news source like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provide coverage of his withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he makes an official announcement through a letter, speech, etc.? 

Criteria for determining the condition: Resolves YES if a debate occurs as described. Resolves NO if it does not. 
Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves YES if the media coverage condition is satisfied. Resolves NO if Biden withdraws but the condition is not fulfilled. Resolves N/A if Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should another Democratic presidential debate take place, will a reliable news organization report on Joe Biden's exit at least 6 hours in advance, provided he opts to step down?
para_P.body:
Consider this scenario as correct: A debate occurs among prospective Democratic candidates (like Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) leading up to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. In this situation, if President Joe Biden decides to withdraw, will a prominent and trustworthy news outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post cover his withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to his formal announcement via a letter, speech, etc.? 

Determining the condition: Resolves YES if a debate takes place as outlined. Resolves NO if it does not. 
Determining the outcome: Resolves YES if the media coverage condition is met. Resolves NO if Biden withdraws but the condition is not satisfied. Resolves N/A if Biden does not withdraw before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Another Democratic party presidential debate takes place (b) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) There will be another presidential debate among Democratic candidates (b) If Joe Biden withdraws, a credible news organization will report on it at least 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if a debate occurs among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be marked as NO otherwise.

(b) This question will be marked as YES if a major, trustworthy news outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on Biden's withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his departure through a letter, speech, etc.

Reports from local news, conspiracy websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not be adequate.

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not step down before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following events will happen: (a) There will be another debate among Democratic party presidential candidates (b) If Joe Biden withdraws, a reputable media source will report the news at least 6 hours beforehand?
para_P.body:

question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Ted Cruz being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This resolves as Yes if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If no such statement is made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

Criteria for the outcome: This will resolve as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official statement indicating that he will not pursue nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be straightforward and definitive. If such a statement is not made by the specified deadline, this will resolve as No.

(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Given the US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value. Then, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024? This resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: If the US Core CPI rises by over 0.1% in July, will Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% when compared to June 2024. The resolution will be based on data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) figure. Consequently, will Biden be considered incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024? This will be resolved as YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other applicable authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

para_P.title: If the US Core CPI rises by over 0.1% in July, will Biden be considered incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body: Assuming this statement holds: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase exceeding 0.1% in comparison to June 2024. The resolution data will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) figure. Consequently, will Biden be regarded as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024? This will be answered with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as Acting President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry. Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

para_P.body: Given the following premise: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 indicates a rise greater than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data will be obtained from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) figure. Therefore, will Biden be viewed as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024? A YES response will be provided if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally state that "the President is unable to execute the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to serve as Acting President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this question. Biden's exit from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024 (b) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context for (b): GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The US Core CPI rises by over 0.1% month-over-month in July 2024, and (b) Biden is deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data used for resolution will be found at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and must utilize the precise (not rounded) figure.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially assert that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context for (b): A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to use the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) The US Core CPI rises by more than 0.1% from June to July 2024 (b) Biden is officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered TRUE if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The resolution will rely on the data found at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, using the precise (non-rounded) figure.

(b) This will be deemed TRUE if the Vice President alongside a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally assert that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question. Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count either.

Context for (b): A GOP lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Will both of the following events occur: (a) The US Core CPI increases by over 0.1% from June to July 2024 (b) Biden is officially declared incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered TRUE if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 indicates a rise of more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The determination will depend on the information available at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, utilizing the exact (non-rounded) figure.

(b) This will be regarded as TRUE if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent authority), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and permits the Vice President to assume presidential duties prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity is not relevant to this inquiry. Biden's exit from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's application of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context for (b): A Republican lawmaker has urged Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, the market will resolve with a no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: In the event that Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed with the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will be considered a yes. If not, the market will be deemed a no.

para_P.title: Could Biden exit the race before July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to step down or be unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will be marked as a yes. Conversely, if he does not withdraw, the market will be classified as a no.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves to yes if Biden drops out or is unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question resolves "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. It strictly pertains to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for legal battles, appeals, or reversals after this date.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, will Donald Trump face removal or prohibition from the primary election ballot in any state of the U.S. according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario holds: Joe Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. Then, is it accurate to say that Donald Trump will be removed or prohibited from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position as of July 15, 2024, under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Criteria for resolution regarding the condition: Resolves to yes if Biden withdraws or is unable to continue the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20.

Criteria for resolution regarding the outcome: Resolves "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or prohibited from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or prohibition must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media outlets. The question resolves "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled as of July 15, 2024. This strictly relates to the situation as of July 15, 2024, and does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or reversals that may occur after this date.

para_P.title: If Biden withdraws before July 20, will Trump face disqualification from the primary ballot in any U.S. state due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario occurs: Joe Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. Then, is it accurate to say that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024?

Criteria for establishing the condition: Resolves to yes if Biden withdraws or cannot continue the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reputable media reports. The question resolves "No" if these criteria are not met by July 15, 2024. It specifically concerns the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or reversals that may occur after this date.

para_P.title: Should Biden decide to step down prior to July 20, could Trump be barred from the primary ballot in any U.S. state due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
In the event that the following situation takes place: Joe Biden steps down or is otherwise unable to proceed with his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. Then, can it be stated that Donald Trump will be barred or disqualified from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024?

Conditions for establishing the scenario: Resolves to yes if Biden steps down or is unable to continue the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20.

Conditions for determining the result: Resolves "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially barred or disqualified from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This barring or disqualification must be confirmed through official statements from state authorities, judicial decisions, legal documents, or credible media sources. The question resolves "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. It specifically pertains to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or reversals that may happen after this date.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body: (a) This condition will be met if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) This condition will be met if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Biden exits the race before July 20, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) This condition will be satisfied if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed with the campaign before July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. (b) This condition will be satisfied if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. The question will be considered "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Scotland will conduct an officially recognized referendum on its independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Scotland carries out a referendum concerning its independence from the United Kingdom before the date of May 3, 2024. This referendum can be classified as an "advisory" referendum; it is not required for the referendum to possess any legally binding authority.

A referendum will not be regarded as resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum if the UK government has refused to grant permission for the vote, nor by a vote arranged by civil society organizations. It is essential that the referendum is recognized as having the approval of the London government.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not be accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** outcome, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any doubt regarding Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered with **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined as **Yes** if Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, asserting that Joe Biden will not seek or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a conclusive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden publicly announce by July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered as **Yes** if Joe Biden or his campaign releases a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, confirming that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election.

For a **Yes** outcome, the announcement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should remove any chance that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a decisive statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of acceptance.

Then, is it true that on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any category indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any similar categories indicating Russian control?

The resolution criteria for the outcome are as follows: The question resolves as YES if the location is assessed to be under Russian control as per the ISW map categories. It resolves as NO if the location is not under Russian control, indicated by categories such as Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, or any similar categories indicating Ukrainian control or a lack of Russian control.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will Russia have authority over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario: Prior to July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement that he will neither seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. This announcement must be explicit and definitive, allowing no possibility of acceptance.

The question is whether, on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as being under any classification suggesting Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any comparable categories denoting Russian authority?

The criteria for determining the outcome are as follows: The question will be answered YES if the location is classified as under Russian control according to the ISW map categories. It will be answered NO if the location is not under Russian control, as indicated by categories such as Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, or any similar classifications suggesting Ukrainian control or absence of Russian control.

This announcement must be unequivocal and final, leaving no possibility for him to accept the nomination later.

In that case, is it accurate that on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as falling under any classification denoting Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Last 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other similar classifications that suggest Russian dominance?

The criteria for determining the outcome are as follows: The question is answered with YES if the location is deemed to be under Russian control according to the ISW map classifications. question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.body:

Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or remarks from individual users on Manifold will not qualify.

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw prior to the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Conditional on Inflection publishing a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Inflection publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024. 

Resolution criteria for this condition: For Inflection, this resolves as YES if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Given this, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for this question: The question resolves as YES if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and NO otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it). If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to certain demographics, this will still resolve positively if at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the service is substantially the same.

"ChatGPT" refers to the overall web platform for engaging with GPT models, and is considered positively if the service remains largely unchanged.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Inflection publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.body:
(a) For Inflection, this question will be answered as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report containing the findings from an *external* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The question will be resolved as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

The term "accessible to the general public" here indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (possibly with a subscription fee). If it is not available in certain EU nations (as seen in Italy in early 2023), or not available to (for instance) minors, it will still be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" in this context refers to the main web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be positively resolved if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

question.title: Conditional on Francis Suarez being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:

Given this, will Joe Biden have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024? The resolution will be based on the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the blue and red trend lines for July 19. If Biden is projected as the favorite, the answer is YES. If Trump is projected as the favorite, the answer is NO. If both have equal odds, the resolution is 50-50. If no data is available for July 19, the nearest previous figures will be used.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the gap between Trump and Biden in 538's national polling average exceed 2 but be at most 3?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the margin by which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden as per 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates Trump's advantage, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the recorded value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, the reported figure for July 5, 2024, shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

In this scenario, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number suggests Biden is ahead. For example, the value reported on July 5, 2024, shows Trump in front of Biden by 2.4 points, which is interpreted as a positive figure of 2.4 for this inquiry.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be determined to be incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will Biden be officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This question resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances does not apply. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator urges Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.
