para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable authority), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to carry out the powers and duties of his office" and permits the Vice President to assume the role of President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not relevant to this question.

Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, or similar events is not considered. Additionally, Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not pertain to this matter.

Context: A Republican legislator is urging Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Given Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will he die before Saturday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Given this, will there be an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th? Resolves YES if such an announcement occurs before this deadline. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). (a) This will be considered TRUE if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded. Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered TRUE if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded. Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(b) This will be considered TRUE if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, it will be considered FALSE.

para_P.title: Could both of these scenarios occur: (a) prior to August 2024, Biden is formally recognized as unable to carry out his responsibilities under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, and (b) Joe Biden dies before the trading day ends on Friday, July 26th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be deemed TRUE if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and designate the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden resigning, dying, etc., does not count. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included. Context: A Republican legislator has asked Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

(b) This will be considered TRUE if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024. If not, it will be regarded as FALSE.

question.title: If Nvidia's market cap exceeds Apple's on July 17, 2024, will Donald Trump be removed from any primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's, as verified by Companies Market Cap and checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). Then, is it true that Donald Trump will have been removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Nvidia's market cap must be greater than Apple's on July 17, 2024, according to Companies Market Cap.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Donald Trump must have been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice. The resolution does not consider legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals occurring after July 15, 2024.

Criteria for assessing the outcome: Donald Trump must have been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must be substantiated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reputable media sources. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be accepted. The resolution will not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or reversals that occur after July 15, 2024.

question.body:

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if 24 or more world records are broken during the Paris Olympics.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The outcome resolves positively if France places in the top 5 in the medal table at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is determined by the total number of medals, ordered by the number of gold, then silver, then bronze medals. If the Olympics do not take place, the outcome resolves ambiguously.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will the US government end its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, will the US Department of Commerce officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024? This question resolves as **Yes** if such termination occurs before August 3, 2024, and **No** if it does not.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden makes a public declaration prior to July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will the US government discontinue its contract with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for a second term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear-cut and definitive, allowing no possibility for Biden to accept the nomination.

Then, will the US Department of Commerce formally end or phase out its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign concerning Verisign's oversight of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) prior to August 3, 2024? This question is answered with **Yes** if such an ending occurs before August 3, 2024, and **No** if it does not.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden makes a public declaration prior to July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will the US government discontinue its contract with Verisign for the .com TLD prior to August 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario is accurate: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility for Biden to accept the nomination.

In that case, will the US Department of Commerce officially end or phase out its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign that acknowledges Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024? This question will be answered with **Yes** if such an end occurs before August 3, 2024, and **No** if it does not.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden publicly announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not seek the Democratic nomination, will the US government terminate its contract with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
Consider the following situation as true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official announcement that he will not be running for nor will he accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unequivocal, leaving no room for Biden to accept the nomination.

In this scenario, will the US Department of Commerce officially conclude or gradually end its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which recognizes Verisign's oversight of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) prior to August 3, 2024? This question will receive a response of **Yes** if such a conclusion takes place before August 3, 2024, and **No** if it does not.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (2) The US government will end its agreement allowing Verisign to manage the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek or accept the nomination for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination. If no such statement is made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(2) Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Given Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from any U.S. state primary ballot for federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under Russian control, indicated by categories such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any similar categories created by ISW.

Then, is the following also true on July 15, 2024: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This would be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when consulted by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was 2.4 points in front of Biden, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden on July 15, 2024, be greater than 2 but less than 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question hinges on the degree of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on July 15, 2024, which will be evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates that Biden is ahead. For example, if on July 5, 2024, the value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, this would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: GIVEN Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average. Then, will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question will resolve as true if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is reported as greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if one of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

para_P.title: IF Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, will a Trump family member be the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024?
para_P.body:

Criteria for determining the condition: The question will be considered true if Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is shown to be greater than 2 and at most 3 on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: Will the Pandemic Accord receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the Pandemic Accord is sanctioned through a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, based on information from reliable sources.

para_P.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned through a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, based on information from reliable sources.

para_P.title: Is the Pandemic Agreement expected to gain endorsement at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is ratified by a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, according to credible information.

question.title: Conditional on the Pandemic Agreement being approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources. 

Then, will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Additionally, Metaculus must verify that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as YES. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If the Pandemic Agreement is ratified at the World Health Assembly in May 2024, will OpenAI make a public commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for disclosing public risks" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Pandemic Agreement is ratified during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), based on information from reliable sources. 

Then, will OpenAI make a public commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for disclosing public risks" before July 1, 2024? 

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves YES if, prior to July 1, 2024, OpenAI makes a public commitment to the "no retaliation for disclosing public risks" principle through a statement from the organization or a representative, such as Sam Altman. This statement can be formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a comment in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must reflect a heightened commitment to the principle compared to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was issued; it cannot simply repeat that, for instance, "we already foster a culture of open criticism". Furthermore, Metaculus must confirm that the organization has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may contact selected signatories or endorsers to gauge their satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as strong as "this was a positive initial step" for this question to be resolved as YES. If this condition is not fulfilled, it resolves N/A.

question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 per share on any day before 7/31. Then, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The market resolves to YES if NVDA closes below $100 on any day before 7/31.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be taken from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.body:

Any other candidates will result in a resolution of **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

question.title: If Ted Cruz is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:

question.body:

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By June 30, 2024, Google DeepMind publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Given this, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if Google DeepMind publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as YES if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, meaning that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. It still resolves positively if unavailable in certain EU countries or to certain groups, as long as >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the name or website has changed but the service remains substantially the same.

para_P.title: If Google DeepMind releases a report featuring findings from external red-teaming by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the public in the EU on that date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By June 30, 2024, Google DeepMind issues a public report containing results from an external entity that has red-teamed the safety of one of their AI models. In light of this, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be publicly accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Criteria for meeting the condition: The condition is satisfied if Google DeepMind releases a public report with findings from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

Criteria for determining the outcome: The question is answered with YES if ChatGPT is available to the public in the EU on June 30, 2024, indicating that individuals in the EU can access it without needing a VPN, potentially requiring payment. It also resolves positively if it is unavailable in specific EU countries or to certain demographics, provided that over 50% of the population has access. "ChatGPT" denotes the general web interface for engaging with GPT models, and the answer remains positive if the name or website changes but the service is fundamentally the same.

para_P.title: If Google DeepMind releases a report with findings from external red-teaming by June 30, 2024, will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible in the EU on that date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: By June 30, 2024, Google DeepMind issues a public report detailing results from an external evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models. Given this scenario, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Criteria for meeting the condition: The condition is considered fulfilled if Google DeepMind releases a public report with findings from an external evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

Criteria for determining the outcome: The question will be answered as YES if ChatGPT is accessible to the public in the EU on June 30, 2024, meaning that individuals in the EU can access it without needing a VPN, with the possibility of payment. It will also be deemed positive if it is not available in certain EU countries or to specific groups, as long as more than 50% of the population can access it. The term "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and it will resolve positively if the name or website changes but the service remains fundamentally the same.

para_P.title: Should Google DeepMind publish a report containing results from external red-teaming by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be available in the EU on that date?
para_P.body:
If we accept the following premise as true: By June 30, 2024, Google DeepMind will release a public document outlining findings from an external assessment regarding the safety of one of their AI systems. In light of this situation, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be available for public use in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Criteria for fulfilling the condition: The condition is satisfied if Google DeepMind publishes a public report with results from an external safety evaluation of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

Criteria for ascertaining the outcome: The answer will be YES if ChatGPT is available to the public in the EU on June 30, 2024, indicating that users in the EU can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. It will also be considered a positive outcome if it is not accessible in certain EU nations or to particular demographics, provided that over 50% of the population can access it. The term "ChatGPT" signifies the general web interface for engaging with GPT models, and the outcome will be favorable if the name or website changes but the service remains essentially unchanged.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) a report detailing the findings from external safety assessments of Google DeepMind's models is released, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is accessible to users within the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question will be marked as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report containing the findings from an *outside* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this question will be marked as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is available to the general public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

Here, "available to the general public" indicates that individuals in the EU can access it without the need for a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as was seen in Italy in early 2023), or restricted to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that over 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the main web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be viewed positively if the branding or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally unchanged (allowing users to submit queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) a report from Google DeepMind detailing the outcomes of external safety evaluations of their models is published, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question will be answered with **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they release a *publicly available* report that includes the findings from an *independent* assessment of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

Here, "broadly accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may require a subscription). If it is not accessible in certain EU nations (like Italy in early 2023) or restricted for specific groups (such as minors), it will still be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web platform (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. The resolution will still be positive if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will both of the following occur: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report outlining the results of external safety assessments of their models, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is made widely available in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, the response will be **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they issue a *publicly accessible* document that presents the results from an *external* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, the answer will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is extensively available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

In this context, "extensively available" indicates that the normal situation for individuals in the EU is that they can access it without the use of a VPN (though it may require a subscription). If it is not available in certain EU countries (like Italy in early 2023) or limited for particular groups (such as minors), it will still be regarded as a positive outcome, as long as more than 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" pertains to the standard web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. The outcome will still be considered positive if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service continues to function in a fundamentally similar manner (permitting users to enter queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the gap between Trump's and Biden's polling be more than 2 but at most 3 according to 538's national average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in polling between Donald Trump and Joe Biden as per 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 but less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved based on the magnitude of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as depicted in the chart from July 15, 2024, when assessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number reflects a lead for Trump, whereas a negative number indicates that Biden is ahead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which means a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: Given Trump’s lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Biden have a 45+ minute in-person interview before end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by accessing the national polling average chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? 

For Biden's interview to count, it must be an in-person interview with at least 45 minutes of new footage of him being interviewed. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not count. Appearances on podcasts, late-night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 Minutes do qualify, provided there is at least 45 minutes of interview footage. If no such interview is released by the end of July, the outcome is NO.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, will Biden conduct a 45+ minute face-to-face interview before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and at most 3, according to 538's national polling average. This can be verified by checking the national polling average chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive figure reflects a Trump lead.

Then, can we confirm that Joe Biden will engage in a face-to-face interview or recorded conversation lasting at least 45 minutes before July 31, 2024? 

To qualify as Biden's interview, it must be an in-person session featuring a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of him being questioned. Events like press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not qualify. However, appearances on podcasts, late-night shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes do count, as long as there is at least 45 minutes of interview footage. If no such interview is made public by the end of July, the result is NO.

para_P.title: If Trump’s margin over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, will Biden conduct a 45+ minute face-to-face interview prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and at most 3, as indicated by 538's national polling average. This can be verified by checking the national polling average chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive figure reflects a Trump advantage.

In that case, can we confirm that Joe Biden will engage in an in-person interview or on-camera discussion lasting at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? 

For Biden's interview to be valid, it must be a face-to-face discussion featuring a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of him being interviewed. Events such as press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., are not counted. However, appearances on podcasts, late-night television, or segments edited into shows like 60 Minutes do qualify, as long as there is at least 45 minutes of interview content. If such an interview is not released by the end of July, the result will be NO.

para_P.title: Should Trump’s lead over Biden be greater than 2 but not exceed 3 on July 15, 2024, will Biden participate in a face-to-face interview lasting over 45 minutes before July 2024 ends?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following scenario: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump holds a lead against Joe Biden that is more than 2 but at most 3, according to 538's national polling average. This can be confirmed by reviewing the national polling average chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive number indicates a Trump lead.

In this situation, can we assert that Joe Biden will take part in an in-person interview or on-camera conversation that lasts a minimum of 45 minutes before July 2024 concludes? 

For Biden’s interview to qualify, it must be a direct interaction that includes no less than 45 minutes of fresh footage of him being interviewed. Activities such as press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not count. However, appearances on podcasts, late-night shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes do count, provided there is at least 45 minutes of interview material. If such an interview is not published by the end of July, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (a) Will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Will Joe Biden engage in a face-to-face interview/conversation on camera lasting 45 minutes or longer, prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is leading. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

(b) The latest qualifying interview was Biden's guest appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

Should Biden participate in another such face-to-face interview for at least 45 minutes, this market will resolve to YES. If no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, this market will resolve to NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a program like 60 Minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video might only contain 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, and thus would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have all featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

A comprehensive list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts can be found here.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Trump will have a lead over Biden that exceeds 2 but is at most 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden will engage in an in-person interview/conversation on camera lasting at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude based on Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would register as a positive figure of 2.4 for this question.

(b) The latest qualifying interview occurred during Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

Should Biden participate in another qualifying in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this market will resolve to YES. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve to NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments of interviews edited into programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in-person for these appearances to be valid. A 50-minute video might contain only 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, thus it would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his February appearance on Jimmy Fallon, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have all featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

A list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts can be found here.

para_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump will surpass Biden by more than 2 but no more than 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden will participate in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be resolved based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden as reported in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed in the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number indicates Trump is ahead, while a negative number signifies Biden's lead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure showed Trump was ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

(b) The most recent qualifying interview took place during Biden's visit to The Howard Stern Show in April, where he answered questions for around 70 minutes. 

If Biden takes part in another qualifying in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this market will resolve to YES. If no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve to NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may consider appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments of interviews edited into programs like 60 Minutes, as long as there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in-person for these appearances to be valid. A 50-minute video might only include 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, thus it would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his February appearance on Jimmy Fallon, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have all contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

A list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts can be found here.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will any of the specified Israeli leaders have arrest warrants issued by the International Criminal Court prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
The answer to this question will be **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below before July 1, 2024. If no warrants are issued, the answer will be **No**.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will any of the specified Israeli leaders have arrest warrants issued by the International Criminal Court prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below before July 1, 2024. It will be deemed **No** in all other cases.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will any of the mentioned Israeli officials face arrest warrants from the International Criminal Court before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues an [arrest warrant](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli leaders listed below prior to July 1, 2024. It will be marked as **No** in all other situations.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Conditional on the ICC issuing arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court issues an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli leaders: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi. Then, will a terrorist attack occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if the ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The attack must be described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The question resolves as No if the above does not happen.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If the ICC issues arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials prior to July 1, 2024, will there be a terrorist incident in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court issues an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli officials: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi. In that case, will a terrorist incident take place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

Criteria for meeting the condition: The condition is satisfied if the ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any of the mentioned Israeli officials before July 1, 2024.

Criteria for determining the outcome: The question is answered with Yes if a terrorist incident in Metropolitan France causes injury and/or death to at least one individual, other than the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The incident must be classified as such by any French state agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The question is answered with No if the above does not occur.

If the condition is not satisfied, the question is answered as N/A.

para_P.title: If the ICC issues arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials prior to July 1, 2024, will there be a terrorist incident in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court issues an arrest warrant for any of these Israeli officials: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi. Then, will a terrorist incident take place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

Criteria for meeting the condition: The condition is satisfied if the ICC issues a warrant for the arrest of any of the mentioned Israeli officials before July 1, 2024.

Criteria for determining the outcome: The question is answered with Yes if a terrorist incident in Metropolitan France results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, other than the perpetrator(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The incident must be classified as such by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The question is answered with No if this does not occur.

If the condition is not fulfilled, the question is resolved as N/A.

para_P.title: Should the ICC release arrest warrants for certain Israeli officials before July 1, 2024, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Prior to July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court issues an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli officials: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi. In that case, will a terrorist act happen in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

Criteria for fulfilling the condition: The condition is met if the ICC issues a warrant for the arrest of any of the specified Israeli officials before July 1, 2024.

Criteria for ascertaining the outcome: The answer to the question will be Yes if a terrorist incident occurs in Metropolitan France resulting in injuries and/or deaths to at least one person, other than the perpetrator(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). This incident must be classified as such by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The answer will be No if this does not happen.

If the condition is not met, the question is deemed N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024 (b) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)

question.title: Conditional on Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If this condition is met, we then inquire whether credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. 

Resolution criterion for the condition: Resolves **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee. Resolves **No** otherwise.

Resolution criterion for the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified at the trial, whether in person or remotely. Resolves **No** otherwise.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if trustworthy sources report that Donald Trump has testified at the trial, regardless of whether it was in person or remotely. Resolves **No** if not. 

If the initial condition is not satisfied, the question is resolved as N/A.

question.title: If Tim Scott is the Republican nominee, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means Tim Scott is the Republican nominee.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves No otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Resolves No if Donald Trump has a higher probability. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, resolves 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves Yes if Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election prediction for July 19, 2024. question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?

If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart for July 15, 2024, as reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, resulting in a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Given an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where at least one athlete wins two or more medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Under this condition:

- The question resolves as **No** if women's teams from eight different National Olympic Committees (NOCs) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics:
  - Association football
  - 3×3 basketball
  - 5×5 basketball
  - Field hockey
  - Handball
  - Rugby sevens
  - Volleyball
  - Water polo.

- Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g., neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

para_P.body:

  - Association football
  - 3×3 basketball
  - 5×5 basketball
  - Field hockey
  - Handball
  - Rugby sevens
  - Volleyball
  - Water polo.

- If not, then the same NOC must have won at least two of these competitions, leading to a **Yes** answer.

The question can be answered as soon as it is evident that one of these scenarios will occur (for instance, if neither team participating in the final of the last event has won any of the others).

question.title: Conditional on Francis Suarez being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between the Republican and Democratic nomination processes for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Condition: Francis Suarez must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Outcome: The question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Assuming Francis Suarez is the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the connection between the nomination processes of the Republican and Democratic parties regarding the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Condition: Francis Suarez must be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Outcome: The question is answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs to conduct more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then the answer is **No**.
