This question explores the interactions between the nomination processes of the Republican and Democratic parties for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Condition: Francis Suarez must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Outcome: The response will be **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is necessary, then the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Francis Suarez is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: (a) Francis Suarez will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who is on the ballot on the day of the election. (b) The Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024 if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) Francis Suarez becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: (a) Francis Suarez will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their nominee. This choice is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who appears on the election day ballot. (b) The Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024 if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate their candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to take place: (a) Francis Suarez becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: (a) Francis Suarez will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their nominee. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than by who appears on the ballot during the election day. (b) The Democrats will face a brokered convention in 2024 if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in their roll call ballot to officially nominate their candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

para_P.title: Will the following two occurrences happen: (a) Francis Suarez is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Democratic Party undergoes a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: (a) Francis Suarez becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if the Republican National Convention delegates choose him as their candidate. This choice is determined by the delegates at the Republican National Convention, not by who is listed on the ballot on election day. (b) The Democratic Party will have a brokered convention in 2024 if they require multiple rounds of voting in their roll call ballot to officially select their candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not apply.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate entity) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and enables the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Could Biden be classified as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This results in a YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable authority), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to perform the duties and responsibilities of his office" and permits the Vice President to assume the role of President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is excluded. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

Context: A GOP legislator asks Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will he announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 2024, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President. Note that Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

Then, will Joe Biden or his campaign make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle? To resolve as Yes, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.

para_P.title: Should Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August, will he publicly declare by July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Prior to August 2024, the Vice President alongside a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that Biden is incapable of fulfilling the responsibilities of his office, resulting in the Vice President taking on the role of Acting President. It is important to note that Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, etc., or the invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not applicable.

In this scenario, will Joe Biden or his campaign issue a clear, public, and official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, confirming that he will not pursue and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for the presidency in the 2024 election? For the answer to be Yes, the announcement must be clear and definitive, with no possibility of accepting the nomination.

para_P.title: Should Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August, will he make a public declaration by July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario is accurate: Prior to August 2024, the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that Biden is incapable of fulfilling the responsibilities of his office, resulting in the Vice President taking on the role of Acting President. It is important to clarify that Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, etc., or the invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not apply.

In this case, will Joe Biden or his campaign issue a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle? For the answer to be Yes, the declaration must be clear-cut and definitive, with no possibility of him accepting the nomination.

para_P.title: If Biden is classified as unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August, will he publicly announce by July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination?
para_P.body:
Consider this scenario to be true: Before August 2024, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that Biden is unable to perform the duties of his office, leading to the Vice President assuming the role of Acting President. It is crucial to note that situations such as Biden's departure from office due to death, resignation, etc., or the application of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment are not relevant here.

In this situation, will Joe Biden or his campaign make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will neither seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle? For the response to be Yes, the announcement must be unequivocal and final, with no chance of him accepting the nomination.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President: This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) Biden to be deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August 2024 and (b) Joe Biden to declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden to be deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August 2024: This will resolve as YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden to declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President: This will resolve as **Yes** if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official announcement stating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should leave no doubt that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body:

(b) Joe Biden stating before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President: This will be resolved as **Yes** if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. If such a clear statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body:
(a) Biden being officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024: This will be resolved as YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden resigning, passing away, etc., does not count. Biden activating section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not taken into account.

(b) Joe Biden announcing before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President: This will be resolved as **Yes** if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election. For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be direct and conclusive: it should remove any chance that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they contend suppresses the crucial ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members remain significantly concerned about the prospects of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He did not confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Background from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to express their opposition to their party’s initiative to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they claim suppresses the crucial ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are quite concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He chose not to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market will be resolved as YES if a public letter opposing the expedited nomination plan is signed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if there are multiple letters totaling 20 lawmakers' signatures, this will also be enough to resolve the market as YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, the market will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will at least 20 Democratic lawmakers from either the House or the Senate publicly sign a letter opposing the push to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

A number of House Democrats are organizing a plan to voice their disapproval of their party’s effort to hasten President Joe Biden’s nomination, arguing that it undermines the essential ongoing conversation about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A letter that has been prepared and shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, marks the first public signal from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many within their ranks are quite worried about the direction of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Some believe it’s a smart way to stifle debate and, through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He opted not to verify the existence of the letter.

This market will be deemed YES if a public letter opposing the accelerated nomination strategy is signed by no fewer than 20 Democratic House members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if several letters collectively contain 20 lawmakers' signatures, that will also suffice to resolve the market as YES. 

If these stipulations are not met by the market close, the market will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

Resolution criteria for the condition: This condition is true if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a Woman, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Then, consider the following: Will the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics? This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as Yes.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have triumphed in at least two of these competitions, leading to a Yes answer.

question.title: Given a Trump family member is the Republican nominee in 2024, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A member of the Trump family becomes the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

Then, will Donald Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat? There are two Manifold polls that close on July 6. One poll asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat. This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

para_P.title: If a member of the Trump family is the Republican candidate for the presidency in 2024, will Trump achieve at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants against Biden?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: A Trump family member is selected as the Republican nominee for the US Presidential election in 2024. This could be Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

Then, will Donald Trump see an increase of at least 3% among Manifold participants when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat? There are two Manifold surveys that conclude on July 6. One survey inquires about votes for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks about votes for a generic Democrat. This question will be resolved as YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the survey with Joe Biden is at least 3% higher than in the survey with a generic Democrat when both surveys conclude. The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the result from poll 1 minus the result from poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

para_P.title: If a member of the Trump family is the Republican candidate in 2024, will Trump secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold voters against Biden?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario: A Trump family member is chosen as the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024. This could be Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

In this case, will Donald Trump achieve a minimum of 3% more support among Manifold respondents when competing against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat? Two Manifold polls will conclude on July 6. One poll solicits votes for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks for votes for a generic Democrat. This question will be resolved as YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the poll with Joe Biden surpasses that in the poll with a generic Democrat by at least 3% once both polls have closed. The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the result from poll 1 minus the result from poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the answer is NO.

para_P.title: Should a Trump family member be the Republican nominee in 2024, will Trump gain at least a 3% advantage among Manifold voters compared to Biden?
para_P.body:
Consider the following situation: A member of the Trump family is selected as the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This could include Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

In this scenario, will Donald Trump receive at least 3% more backing from Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat? Two Manifold surveys will conclude on July 6. One survey asks for votes for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests votes for a generic Democrat. This inquiry will be answered with YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the survey with Joe Biden exceeds that in the survey with a generic Democrat by a minimum of 3% after both surveys are completed. The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the result from the first survey minus the result from the second survey is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 and (b) facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
(a) Resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

(b) Resolves **Yes** if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Manifold poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) a Trump family member will be the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024 and (b) will Trump receive at least 3% more support among Manifold respondents when competing against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:

(b) This resolves **Yes** if the vote percentage for Donald Trump in the Manifold poll against Joe Biden surpasses that against a generic Democrat by 3% or greater when both polls conclude on July 6. The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve as N/A, and will remain open until the closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question may take into account new candidates that may emerge in the future.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will conclude as **No**. The possibility of new candidates emerging in the future will also be taken into account.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the date of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump be the selected nominee for the Republican Party in the upcoming 2024 US Presidential Election?

This question will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** answer. The potential for new candidates to arise in the future will also be considered.

For this question, it is irrelevant who the Republican Party nominates on the day of the 2024 US election; the decision is based exclusively on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be used to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be answered with YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and allow the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is not considered.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be used to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President cannot fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential role due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden's own use of section 3 of the 25th amendment does not apply here.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Section 4 of the 25th Amendment will be invoked to deem Biden unfit before August?
para_P.body:
This will be regarded as a YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable body), enacts Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to carry out the powers and duties of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacitation is not relevant to this question.

Biden stepping down from the presidential position due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's own invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is not relevant in this context.

Context: A Republican legislator urges Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Given Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will 538 project him as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This means the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) have invoked Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024? This will resolve to “Yes” if Biden is projected as more likely to win than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast. It will resolve to “No” if Trump is projected as more likely to win. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this will resolve 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

para_P.title: If Biden is determined to be incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August, will 538 indicate him as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario holds: Biden is deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This implies that the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) have activated Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

In this case, is it accurate to say that Joe Biden will have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024? This will conclude as “Yes” if Biden is forecasted as more likely to win than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's analysis. It will conclude as “No” if Trump is forecasted as more likely to win. If both Biden and Trump have equal chances, this will resolve 50-50. The source for this resolution is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

para_P.title: If Biden is deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August, will 538 indicate him as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Biden is deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This indicates that the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant body) have activated Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

Then, is it accurate to say that Joe Biden will have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024? This will resolve to “Yes” if Biden is anticipated to have a better chance of winning than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast. It will resolve to “No” if Trump is expected to have a better chance. If Biden and Trump are projected to have the same odds, this will resolve 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

para_P.title: Should Biden be classified as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August, will FiveThirtyEight show him as the leading candidate on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the scenario where Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024. This means that the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) has invoked Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally assert that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and permit the Vice President to serve as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

In this case, can we conclude that Joe Biden will have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election in comparison to Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election prediction for July 19, 2024? This will yield a “Yes” if Biden is expected to have a superior chance of winning than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast. Conversely, it will yield a “No” if Trump is anticipated to have a better chance. If Biden and Trump are forecasted to have equal probabilities, this will result in a 50-50 outcome. The resolution will be derived from FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the data represented by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (b) 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.
(b) 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024: This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19. Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following happen: (a) Biden is declared unfit under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (b) 538 shows Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden is declared unfit under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.
(b) 538 shows Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024: This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for that date. If Biden and Trump have equal chances, this market will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the figures indicated by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date. Changes in the way FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will not affect the resolution of this market. This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 becomes available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 data is available. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the nearest prior figures to July 19. Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) Biden is declared unable to perform his presidential duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024, and (b) 538 shows Biden as the leading candidate on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden is declared unable to perform his presidential duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024: This resolves to YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.
(b) 538 indicates Biden as the leading candidate on July 19, 2024: This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight forecast for July 19, 2024. It will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher chance of winning than Biden based on the same forecast. If both candidates have equal chances, the resolution will be 50-50. The resolution will rely on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the figures indicated by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution. Changes in FiveThirtyEight's calculation methods will not affect the outcome of this market. The resolution will be based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 data is accessible. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest previous figures to July 19. It is important to note that the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a percentage out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

para_P.title: Can both of the following situations occur: (a) Biden is deemed unfit to carry out his presidential responsibilities under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, and (b) 538 ranks Biden as the top candidate on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden is deemed unfit to carry out his presidential responsibilities under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024: This will be a YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) formally state that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and permit the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity is not relevant for this inquiry. Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered.
(b) 538 indicates Biden as the top candidate on July 19, 2024: This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden is more likely to win the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight forecast for July 19, 2024. It will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump is more likely to win than Biden based on the same forecast. If both candidates have equal probabilities, the resolution will be 50-50. The resolution will depend on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution. Changes in FiveThirtyEight's calculation methods will not affect the outcome of this market. The resolution will be based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 data is accessible. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest previous figures to July 19. It is crucial to note that the resolution refers to the probabilities of each candidate winning as a percentage out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be considered.

question.title: Will Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

para_P.title: Is Albania set to make it to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Albania takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The inquiry will result in a **No** for any other scenarios concerning Albania.

para_P.title: Is Albania set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Albania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The inquiry will conclude as **No** for any other scenarios concerning Albania.

para_P.title: Will Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The answer will be **No** in all other circumstances regarding Albania.

question.title: Given Albania qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the leading candidate on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump is estimated to have a superior probability of winning the US presidential election relative to Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that both candidates have equal chances, this market will be resolved at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically using the data represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its figures will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will conclude based on the data for July 19 as soon as the figures for July 20 are released. It may not reach a conclusion until the July 20 data is available. If there are no data points for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve using the most recent data prior to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the likelihood of each candidate winning, expressed as a percentage out of 100 rounded to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be taken into account.

question.title: Given 538 Projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected as the favorite over Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast, meaning he has a higher probability of winning than Trump based on the trend lines for that date.

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): This resolves to "Yes" if Biden has a higher probability of winning than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast for July 19, 2024. It resolves to "No" if Trump has a higher probability. If they have equal odds, it resolves 50-50.

Now, given this condition, consider the outcome: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average on July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): This resolves "Yes" if Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points as reported on the FiveThirtyEight national polling average chart for July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

para_P.title: On July 19, 2024, FiveThirtyEight predicts Biden as the frontrunner; will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assume the following is accurate: On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is forecasted to be the frontrunner against Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election analysis, indicating he has a greater chance of winning compared to Trump based on the projections for that date.

Criteria for determining the condition (P): This is deemed "Yes" if Biden is shown to have a higher chance of winning than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast for July 19, 2024. It is considered "No" if Trump is indicated to have a higher chance. If their chances are the same, it resolves to 50-50.

Now, based on this premise, evaluate the outcome: Will Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and at most 4 according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average on July 15, 2024?

Criteria for determining the outcome (Q): This is considered "Yes" if Trump's margin over Biden exceeds 2 and is at most 4 points as per the FiveThirtyEight national polling average chart for July 15, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, a figure of 2.4 implies Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points.

para_P.title: On July 19, 2024, FiveThirtyEight predicts Biden as the frontrunner. Will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on FiveThirtyEight's national polling average?

Assume the following is accurate: As of July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is forecasted to be the leading candidate against Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election analysis, suggesting he has a greater chance of winning than Trump based on the projected trends for that date.

Criteria for determining the condition (P): This is considered "Yes" if Biden exhibits a higher likelihood of winning than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's predictions for July 19, 2024. It is "No" if Trump shows a greater likelihood. If their chances are equal, it results in a 50-50 outcome.

Given this premise, evaluate the following question: Will Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average on July 15, 2024?

Criteria for evaluating the outcome (Q): This is "Yes" if Trump's margin over Biden exceeds 2 and is 4 or fewer points as indicated by the FiveThirtyEight national polling average chart for July 15, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure shows a lead for Biden. For instance, a value of 2.4 signifies that Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points.

para_P.title: On July 19, 2024, FiveThirtyEight predicts Biden as the frontrunner. Will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on FiveThirtyEight's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Consider the following scenario: On July 19, 2024, it is anticipated that Joe Biden will be the primary contender against Donald Trump, according to FiveThirtyEight's election analysis, indicating that Biden is projected to have a higher probability of winning compared to Trump based on the anticipated trends for that date.

The condition (P) is deemed "Yes" if Biden has a greater chance of victory than Trump as per FiveThirtyEight's forecasts for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it is "No" if Trump appears to have a better chance. An equal probability results in a 50-50 situation.

With this understanding, consider the following inquiry: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden exceed 2 and be at most 4 according to the national polling average from FiveThirtyEight on July 15, 2024?

The outcome (Q) is considered "Yes" if Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and 4 or fewer points as shown in the FiveThirtyEight national polling average for July 15, 2024. A positive number indicates Trump is leading, while a negative number indicates Biden is ahead. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is leading Biden by 2.4 points.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden still being president by the end of July, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between Joe Biden's status as president and the opposition within his party to an early nomination plan.

Condition: Joe Biden must still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Outcome of interest: Resolves YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures also suffice. Resolves NO if these criteria are not met by market close.

para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the connection between Joe Biden's presidency and the dissent among his party regarding an early nomination initiative.

Condition: Joe Biden must still hold the official position of president of the United States by 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Outcome of interest: Resolves YES if at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators sign a public letter against the early nomination initiative before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters that collectively gather 20 signatures will also be considered sufficient. Resolves NO if these conditions are not fulfilled by market close.

Outcome of interest: Resolves YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party endorse a public letter against the early nomination plan prior to the market closing on Sunday, July 21st. It is also acceptable if multiple letters collectively hold a total of 20 signatures. Resolves NO if these conditions are not fulfilled by market close.

Condition: Joe Biden must remain in the role of president of the United States until 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Outcome of interest: Resolves to YES if a minimum of 20 Democratic House Members or Senators sign a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. It is also valid if several letters together accumulate at least 20 signatures. Resolves to NO if these criteria are not met by the market close.

question.body: This question resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. (b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also satisfy this condition. If both conditions are not met, this question resolves to NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. (b) Before the market closes on Sunday, July 21, 2024, a public letter opposing the early nomination proposal is signed by at least 20 members of the House or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party. Additionally, multiple letters that collectively have 20 lawmakers' signatures would also meet this requirement. If either of these criteria is not satisfied, the inquiry will result in a NO.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of July 2024, will Joe Biden remain in the presidency, and will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate him early?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) Joe Biden continues to be the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. (b) At least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators have signed a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes on Sunday, July 21, 2024. It is also acceptable if there are multiple letters that together have a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers. If either of these criteria is not satisfied, the answer will be NO.

para_P.title: As of the end of July 2024, will Joe Biden still hold the presidency, and will there be at least 20 Democrats from either the House or Senate who sign a public letter opposing the initiative to nominate him ahead of schedule?
para_P.body: This question will receive a YES response if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. (b) A minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate have endorsed a public letter against the early nomination proposal prior to the market's closure on Sunday, July 21, 2024. It is also permissible for there to be several letters that collectively contain 20 signatures from legislators. If either of these conditions is not met, the response will be NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand during the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has appeared as a witness, either in-person or via remote means, at the [court proceedings](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) regarding the alleged "hush money" transactions involving Stormy Daniels.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump testifying at the hush money trial, will Iran initiate military action before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This question explores the potential correlation between two seemingly unrelated events: Donald Trump testifying at his trial concerning "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and Iran initiating military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory.

Criterion for condition: Credible sources must report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the specified trial.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, as officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory count. Proxy force actions do not count.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial, will Iran commence military operations prior to midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the possible link between two apparently unrelated occurrences: Donald Trump giving testimony at his trial regarding "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and Iran launching military operations on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones.

Condition criterion: Reliable sources must indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or virtually, at the mentioned trial.

Outcome resolution criteria: The question resolves to YES if Iran begins military operations on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, as officially reported by the Iranian government or through a consensus of reliable news sources. This encompasses airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic efforts. Only actions explicitly stated by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian soil are considered. Actions by proxy forces do not qualify.

If the condition is unmet, the question is deemed N/A.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial, will Iran commence military operations prior to midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the possible link between two apparently unrelated incidents: Donald Trump offering testimony at his trial regarding "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and Iran launching military operations on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries.

Condition criterion: Reliable sources must confirm that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the designated trial.

Outcome resolution criteria: Resolves to YES if Iran undertakes military operations on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, as officially recognized by the Iranian government or by a consensus of trustworthy reporting. This encompasses airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground incursions, but excludes cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic measures. Only actions explicitly stated by Iran or verified to have originated from Iranian territory will be counted. Actions by proxy forces will not be considered.

If the condition is not satisfied, the question will be resolved as N/A.

para_P.title: Should Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial, will Iran initiate military actions before midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This question explores the potential connection between two seemingly unrelated events: Donald Trump testifying in his trial concerning "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and Iran commencing military actions on Israeli territory, within its airspace, or in its maritime zones.

Condition criterion: Credible sources must verify that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or remotely, at the specified trial.

Outcome resolution criteria: The question will be answered YES if Iran engages in military actions on Israeli territory, within its airspace, or in its maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, as officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or by a consensus of reliable reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval operations, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Only actions explicitly stated by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will be included. Activities conducted by proxy forces will not be taken into account.

If the condition is not met, the question will be deemed N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial? (b) Will Iran initiate a military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(b) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers will not be considered for the resolution of this market.

Only actions taken by Iranian forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have been initiated from Iranian territory, will be counted toward the resolution of this market. question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he receive at least 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, yet every other Democrat included in hypothetical surveys either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the views of Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll is at least 3% greater than in the second poll when both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the result is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A, and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.
