question.title: Conditional on Trump gaining at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO.

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Suppose the following is true: The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. Then, will a group of at least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?

para_P.body:

One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their votes for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote for a generic Democrat. This question will be answered YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

According to Politico:

Two members from safe districts have already publicly asked Biden to step down. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local news that they believe Biden has no chance to win in November.

Behind the scenes, the activity is even more intense. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, with at least one draft urging Biden to conclude his campaign, as indicated by five sources familiar with these efforts.

This market will resolve YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party House Members or Senators collaborates to encourage Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to press him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter as reported above, or it could involve a group conversing with Biden in person and collectively requesting him to withdraw.

For a YES resolution, all five individuals must be part of the same collective message. Merely having five individuals independently stating to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient.

Any reports of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden to request he step aside will not meet the criteria for this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's conclusion. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

Assuming it is true that the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close, then will a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party House Members or Senators collaborate to pressure Biden to withdraw before July 20th?

question.title: Conditional on Elon Musk attending Bitcoin Nashville 2024, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

This market will resolve YES, if Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

Suppose the following is true: Elon Musk shows up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024.

Then, will Donald Trump be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for Trump removal: The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question resolves as "Yes" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024, and "No" if they are not.

para_P.title: Should Elon Musk attend Bitcoin Nashville 2024, will Donald Trump be barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not suffice for resolution. question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

The question will resolve as NO if either condition (a) or (b) is not met.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but no more than 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as presented on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump have a lead over Joe Biden that exceeds 2 but does not surpass 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart for July 15, 2024, when it is reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump be ahead of Joe Biden by more than 2 but less than 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved by examining the margin by which Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the date of July 15, 2024, which will be analyzed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number denotes a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates Biden is ahead. For example, if on July 5, 2024, the figure shows Trump leading by 2.4 points, this would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.body:
(a) As of July 15, 2024, the national polling average from 538 for the 2024 presidential election will show Trump's margin over Biden, which will be evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive score indicates Trump's advantage, which should be greater than 2 but not exceeding 3 points.

(b) On June 28, 2024, the market capitalization of Nvidia will be compared to that of Apple, using information from Companies Market Cap, and this will be confirmed by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA emerge as the group with the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction possesses the highest seat count after the 2024 elections for the European Parliament, and will be marked as **No** for any other results. In the event that two factions are equal in seat count, both sub-questions will be recorded as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

This question will be determined based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA coalition obtain the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

The determination will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media outlets.

question.title: If Greens–EFA holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

Then, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024? The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Conditional on Disney announcing a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024, will Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
This question explores the potential correlation between two independent events: Disney's announcement of a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024, and the box office performance of the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.

Criterion for the condition: Resolves YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It resolves NO if it is only discussed as an idea or if announced for a different park.

Criterion for the outcome: Resolves YES if "Deadpool x Wolverine" grosses more than $284.5M globally in its opening weekend and is reported as the record for an R-rated movie release by the Hollywood Reporter or equivalent publication. Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

The current record for the biggest opening weekend for an R-rated film is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic). BoxOfficeMojo figures should be regarded as unofficial until confirmed by the Hollywood press.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump have a lead over Joe Biden that exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure denotes a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but be at most 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the context of this question.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump have a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 but not more than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered by examining the margin by which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as recorded on July 15, 2024, and reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

A positive number indicates Trump's lead, whereas a negative number indicates Biden's lead. For example, if the value on July 5, 2024, shows Trump ahead by 2.4 points, it would count as a positive figure of 2.4 for this inquiry.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. This is determined by accessing 538's national polling average chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that before May 1, 2024, credible reports will indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals? The attack must occur after the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, to be considered.

Is it then accurate to say that before May 1, 2024, reliable sources will report that an assault linked to Israel, taking place within the borders of Iran, has resulted in the deaths of at least five people? The incident must happen after this question is published and before May 1, 2024, to qualify.

Is it correct to conclude that prior to May 1, 2024, credible sources will indicate that an Israeli-related attack has occurred within Iran, resulting in the deaths of no fewer than five individuals? Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. question.title: Conditional on the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index being higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question combines two conditions:

1. **Condition**: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) must be higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023. This will be verified based on the St. Louis Fed's reporting at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

2. **Outcome of Interest**: Israel must carry out a deadly attack within Iran's borders resulting in the death of at least five individuals, as indicated by credible reports, between the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024.

The question resolves **Yes** if both conditions are met, **No** if the first condition is met but the second is not, and **N/A** if the first condition is not met.

para_P.body: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) needs to be greater on July 20, 2024, compared to its value on July 20, 2023, as per the St. Louis Fed's analysis: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. para_P.body: (a) By July 20, 2024, the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) needs to show a higher reading than it did on July 20, 2023, based on the report from the St. Louis Fed: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. (b) Reliable sources must confirm that, after the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, an assault linked to Israel that occurs within Iranian territory has resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

para_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) surpasses its July 20, 2023 value on July 20, 2024? (b) An Israeli military operation resulting in fatalities takes place in Iran before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) On July 20, 2024, the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) must reflect a value greater than that recorded on July 20, 2023, according to the St. Louis Fed's report: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. (b) Credible sources should verify that, following the release of this inquiry and prior to May 1, 2024, an Israeli attack occurring within Iran has led to the deaths of no fewer than five individuals.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to stay in office until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if Biden continues to serve as the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be a NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES outcome. (An Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview occurred when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

This market will resolve to YES if Biden engages in another in-person interview that lasts at least 45 minutes. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve to NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. However, it may include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews that are edited into programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for those appearances to count. For example, a 50-minute video might only show 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his guest spot on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have each contained less than 30 minutes of footage featuring Biden being interviewed.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will engage in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview occurred when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

For this market to resolve YES, Biden must participate in another in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes. If no qualifying interview is released before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve NO. 

This market does not consider press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person. A 50-minute video could contain only 20 minutes of Biden's interview footage, which would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interviews with Stephanopoulos in July, his February appearance on Jimmy Fallon, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have all had less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

para_P.title: Could Joe Biden participate in a direct, on-camera conversation or interview exceeding 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The most recent qualifying interview took place when Biden appeared on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he answered questions for around 70 minutes. 

For this market to conclude with a YES, Biden must take part in another face-to-face interview lasting at least 45 minutes. If no qualifying interview is released by the market's closing at the end of July, it will end with a NO. 

This market does not account for press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes, as long as there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person. A 50-minute video could contain only 20 minutes of Biden's interview footage, which would not qualify.

For context, Biden's interviews with Stephanopoulos in July, his February appearance on Jimmy Fallon, and his past segments on 60 Minutes have all included less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: Given Joe Biden has an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera lasting at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, or rallies, but can include appearances on a podcast, late night show, or interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Then, is it also true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This is determined by the reported value on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 3 but be 4 or fewer on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden engages in a direct interview or on-camera discussion that lasts no less than 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, or rallies, but may include guest appearances on podcasts, late-night television shows, or edited interviews featured in programs like 60 Minutes, as long as there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage showing Biden being interviewed in person.

Then, can we also assert that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 3 and at most 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This will be determined by the figure reported on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as of July 15, 2024, which will be accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number indicates a lead for Trump.

(1) Joe Biden must have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, and will Donald Trump be ahead of Biden by a margin of 3 to 4 points on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden engage in a direct interview exceeding 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, and will Donald Trump be leading Biden by a margin between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden must participate in a direct interview or on-camera conversation lasting at least 45 minutes prior to July 31, 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. The interview could occur on a podcast, a late-night show, or a program like 60 Minutes, but it must feature at least 45 minutes of new footage with Biden in a face-to-face interview. 

(2) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump is required to be ahead of Joe Biden by more than 3 points and no more than 4 points based on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump. This metric will be assessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still quite troubled about the prospects of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a smart tactic to close off debate and I suppose through sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t function that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures combined would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: If at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan, will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

Resolution criterion for the condition: This condition resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if any athlete achieves a minimum of two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.body: This question will be deemed **Yes** if at least one athlete earns two or more medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Given an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This means any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, is it true that Individual Neutral Athletes will collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, according to the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. Otherwise, it resolves to "No". If confirmed before the end of the Games that they have won 21 or more gold medals, it resolves immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: If an athlete secures multiple tennis medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes achieve at least 21 gold medals?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: An athlete secures multiple medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, meaning that any athlete obtains a minimum of two tennis medals during the event. Then, is it accurate to say that Individual Neutral Athletes will together earn 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

The criteria for determining the outcome: This will be considered "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively earn 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources. If it is confirmed before the conclusion of the Games that they have indeed won 21 or more gold medals, it will immediately be resolved as "Yes".

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) At least one athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Background from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to oppose their party’s move to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they believe suppresses the critical ongoing discussions regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker participating in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, serves as the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are significantly concerned about the direction of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and somehow force unity, but that’s not how it operates,” Huffman mentioned in an interview. He chose not to verify the existence of the letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement opposing the expedited nomination initiative is endorsed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Ted Cruz is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Suppose Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question resolves as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is indeed the nominee, as determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Given this scenario, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model? Specifically, the question resolves **Yes** if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It resolves **No** otherwise.

Link to model: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Conditional on the Prime Minister of France not belonging to New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024. This will be determined if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

Then, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will BOTH of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024 (b) The ID political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) This component resolves as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.
(b) This component resolves as Yes if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as No for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as Yes. This resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Is it true that BOTH of the following will happen: (a) On July 30, 2024, the Prime Minister of France will be part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together, and (b) the ID political group will secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
(a) This part will be considered Yes if, as of July 30th at 12:00 Central European Time, the party of the Prime Minister of France is not affiliated with New Popular Front or Together, based on reliable sources.
(b) This part will be regarded as Yes if the ID political group has the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. All other political groups will be marked as No. In the event of a tie between two groups for the number of seats, both components will be marked as Yes. This determination will rely on official announcements from the European Parliament or trustworthy media coverage.

para_P.title: Is it true that BOTH of the following will take place: (a) The French Prime Minister will be part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024 (b) The ID political faction will secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
(a) This part is answered with Yes if the coalition of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.
(b) This part is answered with Yes if the ID political faction has the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. All other political factions will be resolved as No. If there is a tie in the number of seats between two factions, both sub-questions will be answered as Yes. This will be determined by official announcements from the European Parliament or trustworthy media reports.

para_P.title: Will BOTH of the following events occur: (a) On July 30, 2024, the Prime Minister of France will be involved in a coalition that is neither the New Popular Front nor Together, and (b) the ID political group will achieve the greatest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be confirmed with a Yes if the coalition involving the French Prime Minister is not the New Popular Front or Together on July 30th at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.
(b) This will be confirmed with a Yes if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. Any other political groups will be considered as No. In the case of a tie in seat counts between two groups, both sub-questions will be answered as Yes. This will be established through official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media outlets.

question.title: Conditional on "House of the Dragon" S2E8 being rated >8.5 on IMDB, will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The season finale of "House of the Dragon" Season 2, Episode 8, receives a rating greater than 8.5 on IMDB, as determined by the score displayed two days after its release (August 6th), at noon PT. This is based on the precision listed by IMDB and is a strict inequality. 

Then, is it true that M. Night Shyamalan's film "Trap" (2024) will receive a CinemaScore of B or higher? The resolution criteria for "Trap" are as follows: it resolves YES if "Trap" receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and NO if it receives a B- or lower. If no CinemaScore is reported, this resolves N/A. 

For context, "Trap" is the next film directed by M. Night Shyamalan, and his recent films have received the following CinemaScores: "Split" - B+, "Glass" - B, "Old" - C+, "Knock at the Cabin" - C.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be included later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with a **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected as the nominee by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States. Any other selections will result in a **No**. This inquiry is not confined to the candidates currently in the running; new candidates may emerge later.

For the purpose of this question, it is irrelevant who the Republican Party nominates on the election day in 2024; the conclusion is solely based on the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Ted Cruz is the Republican nominee, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024? This will be assessed based on the chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

para_P.title: Should Ted Cruz become the Republican candidate, will Donald Trump have a lead over Joe Biden that exceeds 2 but does not surpass 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is nominated on the election day.

Then, can we say that Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024? This will be evaluated using the data for July 15, 2024, as retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden.

para_P.title: Should Ted Cruz become the Republican candidate, will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is nominated on election day.

Then, can we confirm that Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be more than 2 but at most 3 on July 15, 2024? This will be evaluated using the data for July 15, 2024, as retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates a Biden lead.

para_P.title: If Ted Cruz is selected as the Republican nominee, will Donald Trump hold a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 but less than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
Let us assume the following scenario: Ted Cruz is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the upcoming 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the nominee chosen on the day of the election.

In this case, can we ascertain that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be above 2 but not exceed 3 on July 15, 2024? This will be assessed using the data available for July 15, 2024, as obtained by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value reflects a Biden lead.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (2) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. **Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.** This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. **Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024.** This is based on the value reported for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) Ted Cruz becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (2) Trump's advantage over Biden falls between greater than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, as per 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. **Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.** This determination is made based on the selection by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. **Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) exceeds 2 and is at most 3 on July 15, 2024.** This is based on the figure reported for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number indicates a lead for Trump.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (1) Ted Cruz becoming the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (2) Trump's advantage over Biden being more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, as per 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. **Ted Cruz is chosen by the delegates at the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.** This is determined by the decision made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than the nominee announced on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. **Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024.** This is based on the figure recorded for July 15, 2024, when it is accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

2. **Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is more than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024.** This is based on the figure recorded for July 15, 2024, when it is reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. question.title: Will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and winner's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: Are Kalenjin runners expected to secure victories in both the men's and women's marathon events at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both the male and female marathon champions at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris originate from the Kalenjin community, as per [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: Are Kalenjin runners going to triumph in the marathon events for both men and women at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both the male and female marathon champions at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris originate from the Kalenjin community, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.body:

question.title: Conditional on Liz Cheney being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question combines two forecasting scenarios:

1. **Condition**: Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of any other candidates.

2. **Outcome**: Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, and official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

Resolution: If Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee, then the question resolves YES if Joe Biden makes such an announcement before the deadline, and NO if he does not. If Liz Cheney is not the Republican nominee, the question resolves N/A.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.body:
This will be resolved as YES if Joe Biden makes a statement indicating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he intends to resign, thereby not finishing his existing term. Such announcements must occur prior to the end of July 2024, according to Pacific Time; however, he is not required to have formally resigned or vacated his office by then. A declaration of his plan to do so will suffice to settle this market.

If this does not occur, the market will resolve as NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will both of the following events occur: (a) Joe Biden announces his resignation from the presidency and withdrawal from the race before the end of July 2024, and (b) the USD reaches or surpasses 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered YES if Joe Biden makes a public announcement that he is stepping down from his presidency and is no longer seeking re-election, with these declarations made prior to the conclusion of July 2024 in Pacific Time. It is not required for him to have officially vacated the office by that date; a public intent to resign will be enough for this market to resolve positively.

If this does not transpire, it will be recorded as NO on August 1st.

(b) This will be considered YES if the final exchange rate for USD/JPY is noted as >= 145 on August 9th, 2024 according to Yahoo! Finance.

question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) recommend that Tesla investors oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation plan or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
para_P.body: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla investors to vote *against* Elon Musk's remuneration package during the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the board of directors. If not, the question will be resolved as **No**.

para_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) recommend that Tesla shareholders oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
para_P.body: This question will be considered **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly recommending that Tesla shareholders vote *against* Elon Musk's compensation package during the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the board of directors. If not, the question will be resolved as **No**.

para_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will ISS advise Tesla shareholders to reject Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) provides a statement explicitly urging Tesla shareholders to cast their votes *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the board. If this does not occur, the question will be answered as **No**.

question.title: If ISS advises against Musk's package or re-election, will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, the question will resolve as **No**.

Suppose the above condition is true. Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Should ISS recommend against Musk's compensation or re-election, will Donald Trump Jr. secure the Republican nomination for 2024?
para_P.body:
The question will yield a resolution of **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's compensation package during the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board. If neither of these conditions is met, the question will resolve as **No**.

Assuming the aforementioned condition holds true, will Donald Trump Jr. be chosen as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will result in a **No**. This inquiry is not confined to the candidates currently under consideration; additional candidates may emerge in the future. For this question, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is determined solely by the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Should ISS recommend against Musk's compensation package or re-election, will Donald Trump Jr. secure the Republican nomination for 2024?
para_P.body:
The inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's compensation package during the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board. In all other cases, the inquiry will resolve as **No**.

Assuming the aforementioned condition holds true, will Donald Trump Jr. be chosen as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will be answered with a **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will be deemed as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently under consideration; additional options may emerge later. For this question, it is irrelevant who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by the choice of the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Will ISS advise against Musk's pay package or re-election, and will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) publicly recommends that Tesla shareholders vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR against Kimbal Musk's re-election to the Tesla board. In all other situations, the answer will be **No**.

If the above condition is met, will Donald Trump Jr. become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will be marked as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be considered as **No**. This question is not restricted to the current candidates; other possibilities may arise later. The decision on who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election is not relevant; it will be based solely on the choice made by the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

(1) The first condition will resolve as **Yes** if ISS releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* either Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. para_P.body:
