question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Crimean Bridge will experience an attack prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, following May 2, 2024, and before the specified date, [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been targeted by gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that could threaten the structural integrity of the bridge.

para_P.title: Will the Crimean Bridge experience an assault prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if, between May 2, 2024, and the specified date, [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been impacted by gunfire, explosives, or missiles that could represent a significant risk to the structure of the bridge.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Crimean Bridge will be attacked before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be affirmed with a **Yes** if, during the period from May 2, 2024, up until the mentioned date, [trustworthy sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has suffered from gunfire, explosives, or missiles posing a serious threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Given the Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. Then, is it true that Joe Biden will still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024?

para_P.title: If the Crimean Bridge experiences an attack prior to July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden remain in office until the end of July?
para_P.body: Assuming the following scenario is accurate: Between May 2, 2024, and July 1, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been targeted with gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that could significantly threaten the structure of the bridge. In that case, is it accurate to say that Joe Biden will still hold the position of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024?

para_P.title: If the Crimean Bridge experiences an attack prior to July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden remain in office by the end of July?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds: Between May 2, 2024, and July 1, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been targeted with gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that could seriously threaten the structure of the bridge. Therefore, is it accurate to say that Joe Biden will still hold the position of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024?

para_P.title: Should the Crimean Bridge be attacked before July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden continue to serve as president by the end of July?
para_P.body: Given the following conditions: From May 2, 2024, to July 1, 2024, credible reports suggest that the Crimean Bridge has come under fire from guns, explosives, or projectiles that pose a significant risk to the integrity of the bridge. Thus, can we assert that Joe Biden will still be in the role of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge; and (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) An attack on the Crimean Bridge occurs prior to July 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden remains in office as president at the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Between May 2, 2024, and July 1, 2024, [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been targeted with gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that could significantly threaten the structural integrity of the bridge; and (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States.

para_P.title: Will there be an attack on the Crimean Bridge prior to July 1, 2024, while Joe Biden remains president until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Between May 2, 2024, and July 1, 2024, [reputable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been targeted by weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could seriously threaten the bridge's structural integrity; and (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden continues to be the officially recognized president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is an assault on the Crimean Bridge expected before July 1, 2024, with Joe Biden still serving as president until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) From May 2, 2024, to July 1, 2024, [trustworthy sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been subjected to attacks involving gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that pose a significant risk to the bridge's structural integrity; and (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden remains the officially acknowledged president of the United States.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This is answered with YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the responsibilities and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with YES if the Vice President, together with a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable entity), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to carry out the responsibilities and duties of his office" and permits the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not impact this question.

Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not relevant. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not relevant.

Context: A GOP legislator urges Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will the ICC issue arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This occurs if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then, is it true that before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) will issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)? It resolves as Yes if such a warrant is issued before July 1, 2024, and No otherwise.

para_P.title: Should Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August, will the ICC release arrest warrants for any Israeli officials listed before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Biden is deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024. This situation arises if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., or the invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not apply.

Then, is it accurate that prior to July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) will issue an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli government officials: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)? The answer is Yes if such a warrant is issued before July 1, 2024, and No otherwise.

para_P.title: Should Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August, will the ICC release arrest warrants for any specified Israeli officials before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario: Biden is deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024. This situation arises if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President temporarily, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is not included.

Then, is it accurate to say that prior to July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) will issue an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)? The answer is Yes if such a warrant is issued before July 1, 2024, and No if it is not.

para_P.title: If Biden is classified as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August, will the ICC issue arrest warrants for any designated Israeli officials before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Considering this scenario: Biden is classified as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024. This occurs if the Vice President, together with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority), activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is incapable of executing the powers and duties of his office" and permits the Vice President to serve as Acting President temporarily, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., or the invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is excluded.

Therefore, can it be said that before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) will release an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli cabinet officials: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)? The response is Yes if such a warrant is issued before July 1, 2024, and No if it is not.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (b) the ICC issue arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of these events will take place: (a) Biden being officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024, and (b) the ICC issuing arrest warrants for any of the specified Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate entity) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not applicable.

(b) This question will be considered **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant for arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below. It will be marked as **No** in all other cases.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following situations will take place: (a) Biden is officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, and (b) the ICC will issue arrest warrants for any of the specified Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered **Yes** if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is not relevant to this question. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

(b) This will be answered **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant for arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below before July 1, 2024. It will be answered **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Is it feasible that both of the following events will occur: (a) Biden is officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024, and (b) the ICC will release arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as **Yes** if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to execute the powers and duties of his office" and permits the Vice President to serve as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this inquiry. Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not relevant. Additionally, Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not applicable.

(b) This will receive a **Yes** response if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant for arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members mentioned below before July 1, 2024. Otherwise, it will be answered **No**.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024 indicating that he will not accept the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024 indicating that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign delivers a clear, public, official statement declaring that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Additional details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Please reach out to @jskf for early resolution requests or to report any issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare his refusal to accept the Democratic nomination for President before July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make a declaration prior to July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for the position of President?

This resolves identically to the original question on Metaculus.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden makes a definitive, public, and official announcement before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. This announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.

Then, is it true that Chris Christie will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution for this question is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his withdrawal from the presidential race and his resignation from office prior to the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
This will be resolved as YES if Joe Biden makes a declaration that he is no longer pursuing re-election and that he intends to resign, thereby not finishing his current presidential term. Such declarations must occur before the end of July 2024, in Pacific Time; however, it is not necessary for him to have officially resigned and vacated his position by that time. A statement of his intention to resign will be adequate to resolve this market.

If he does not make such announcements, this market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his intention to withdraw from the race and step down from the presidency prior to the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if Joe Biden makes a statement indicating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and plans to resign, thus not finishing his current presidential term. Such statements must be made before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time, although he does not need to have officially resigned and vacated his position by that date. A declaration of his plan to do so will suffice to resolve this market.

If he does not make such an announcement, the market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will announce his decision to exit the race and resign from the presidency before July ends?
para_P.body:
This will be determined as YES if Joe Biden issues a statement indicating that he is halting his re-election campaign and intends to resign, thereby not completing his current term as president. Such a declaration must occur before the close of July 2024, Pacific Time, although he is not required to have officially stepped down and left his role by that time. A statement of his intention to do so will be adequate to resolve this market.

If he fails to make such an announcement, the market will conclude with a NO on August 1st.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning before the end of July, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. This means he announces his intention to not complete his current term and to drop out of the race. Note that he does not have to have formally resigned by the end of July, just announced his intention to do so. Given this, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for witness tampering related to potential witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024? The indictment must occur before June 1, 2024 for the resolution to be YES.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden declare his withdrawal from the presidential race and step down prior to the end of July, will Donald Trump face charges for witness tampering in Georgia ahead of June 1, 2024?
para_P.body: Imagine the following scenario: Joe Biden makes an announcement that he is no longer pursuing re-election and intends to resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. This indicates his decision to not finish his current term and to exit the race. It is important to note that he only needs to announce his intention to resign by the end of July, not necessarily complete the formal resignation. In light of this situation, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for witness tampering concerning potential witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* prior to June 1, 2024? For the answer to be YES, the indictment must take place before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden declare his withdrawal and resignation prior to the conclusion of July, will Donald Trump face charges for witness tampering in Georgia ahead of June 1, 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following scenario: Joe Biden declares that he is stepping down from his re-election campaign and will resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. This indicates his intention to not serve out his current term and to exit the race. It is important to note that he only needs to announce this intention and does not have to formally resign by the end of July. In light of this, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for witness tampering concerning potential witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* prior to June 1, 2024? For the answer to be YES, the indictment must take place before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden announces his intention to withdraw and resign before the end of July, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
para_P.body: Consider this scenario: Joe Biden makes a public statement indicating that he is withdrawing from his re-election bid and will resign from his presidential position before the conclusion of July 2024, Pacific Time. This shows his decision to not complete his current term and to leave the race. It is essential to understand that he only needs to declare this intent and is not required to officially resign by the end of July. Given this situation, will Donald Trump face charges or an indictment for witness tampering related to potential witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* prior to June 1, 2024? For the response to be YES, the indictment must occur before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning before the end of July 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this component.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

The combined question resolves YES if both (a) and (b) occur as described.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will happen: (a) Joe Biden makes an announcement about withdrawing from the race and resigning prior to the conclusion of July 2024, and (b) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden declares that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and intends to resign from his current position, with these announcements taking place before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. He does not need to have officially left office by that time; a statement of his plan to resign is adequate for this part to resolve positively.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted regarding any remarks pertaining to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. These charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

The overall question will resolve YES if both (a) and (b) occur as specified.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden declares he is withdrawing and resigning prior to the conclusion of July 2024, and (b) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?

(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement stating that he is not continuing his campaign for re-election and that he will resign, thereby not finishing his current term. This announcement must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he does not need to have officially resigned and vacated his position by that time. A declaration of his intention to resign is adequate to resolve this part.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any remarks related to possible witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

The overall question resolves YES if both (a) and (b) happen as outlined.

(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden makes a statement indicating that he will not continue his campaign for re-election and that he intends to resign, thus not completing his current term. This statement must be issued before the close of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he is not required to have officially resigned and left his position by then. A declaration of his plan to resign suffices to resolve this part.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted regarding any statements about potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The charges need to be filed prior to June 1, 2024.

The overall question resolves YES if both (a) and (b) occur as specified.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, will he see an increase of at least 3% among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to vote alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a generic Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat in hypothetical scenarios is either leading or within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll is at least 3% higher than in the second poll when both polls close. 

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is 0.03 or greater. Otherwise, the result is NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A, and will remain open until the designated close time regardless of circumstances.

para_P.body:
There are two Manifold surveys available, both of which conclude on July 6. One survey prompts Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other invites them to choose a typical Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public sentiment surveys repeatedly indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in these hypothetical scenarios is polling either ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold participants indicative of the broader public?

This market will determine a YES outcome if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater at the time both polls conclude.

The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Others)). The result is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the result is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve to N/A and will stay open until the closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Nikki Haley being the Republican nominee, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
This question explores the potential political dynamics if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution criterion for this condition is that Nikki Haley must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee.

Given this scenario, the outcome we are interested in is whether the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) will invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that President Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, thereby making the Vice President serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). It does not matter how long the incapacity lasts for this question to resolve as YES.

It should be noted that Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count for this question. The context involves discussions around the potential invocation of the 25th Amendment as raised by a GOP lawmaker.

para_P.title: If Nikki Haley is the Republican candidate, will Biden be declared unfit under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the possible political circumstances if Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The condition for this scenario is that Nikki Haley must be nominated by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Under these conditions, we are interested in whether the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) will activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare President Biden incapable of fulfilling the responsibilities of his office, thus allowing the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question to be answered with YES.

It is important to clarify that Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, or the application of section 3 of the 25th amendment does not apply to this inquiry. The focus is on the discussions regarding the potential use of the 25th Amendment as suggested by a GOP legislator.

para_P.title: Assuming Nikki Haley is the Republican candidate, will Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This inquiry investigates the possible political implications if Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The condition for this scenario is that Nikki Haley must be nominated by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

In this context, we are concerned with whether the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) will activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that President Biden is unable to perform the responsibilities of his office, thus allowing the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question to be answered affirmatively.

It is important to clarify that Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, or the application of section 3 of the 25th amendment does not apply to this question. The focus is on the potential activation of the 25th Amendment as proposed by a GOP legislator.

This question explores the potential political ramifications if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election. The premise is that Nikki Haley must be nominated by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

In this scenario, we are examining whether the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable authority) will invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that President Biden is unfit to carry out the responsibilities of his position, thereby enabling the Vice President to assume the role of President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is not relevant for the affirmative response to this question.

It is crucial to note that Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, or the implementation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is not pertinent to this inquiry. The emphasis is on the possible invocation of the 25th Amendment as suggested by a GOP legislator.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., or the invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment does not apply.

This determination is based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the date of the 2024 US election.

(b) The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., or the invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is not considered.

para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if the following two conditions are met:

(a) Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based on the choices made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who is declared the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden's exit from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., or the activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is not taken into account.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes, prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview occurred when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

This market will resolve to YES if Biden takes part in another in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve to NO. 

This market does not consider press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. However, it may include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments of interviews featured in programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be valid. For instance, a 50-minute video might only show 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden’s interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes all contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview took place in April when Biden was featured on The Howard Stern Show, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

For this market to resolve as YES, Biden must participate in another in-person interview for a minimum of 45 minutes. If no qualifying interview is published by the market close at the end of July, the market will resolve as NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include podcast appearances or late-night show segments, or interviews that are part of edited programs like 60 Minutes, provided that there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. A 50-minute video could feature only 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his February appearance on Jimmy Fallon, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes each contained less than 30 minutes of interview footage with Biden.

para_P.title: Could Joe Biden take part in a live interview or discussion on camera that lasts more than 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The most recent qualifying interview occurred in April during Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show, where he answered questions for around 70 minutes. 

For this market to conclude as YES, Biden needs to engage in another face-to-face interview lasting at least 45 minutes. If no qualifying interview is released by the market close at the end of July, the market will conclude as NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may consider podcast appearances or segments from late-night shows, or interviews that are part of edited programs like 60 Minutes, as long as there is at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden in an in-person interview. A 50-minute video could include only 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not meet the criteria. 

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his February appearance on Jimmy Fallon, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes each had less than 30 minutes of interview footage with Biden.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden having an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there are at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. It does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. It will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: Assuming Joe Biden conducts a face-to-face interview lasting over 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024, will Donald Trump face removal or obstruction from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the following scenario: Joe Biden engages in a face-to-face interview or on-camera discussion for more than 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024. This can include appearances on podcasts or late-night television shows, or an interview that is incorporated into a program such as 60 Minutes, provided there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden in an in-person interview. However, this does not encompass press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, or town hall meetings.

Under these circumstances, will it be the case that Donald Trump is removed or obstructed from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the provisions of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This will be marked as "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially removed or obstructed from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as verified by official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. It will be marked as "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, will Donald Trump be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot for any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario is accurate: Joe Biden engages in a face-to-face interview or on-camera discussion for more than 45 minutes before July 31, 2024. This encompasses appearances on podcasts or late-night television shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes, as long as there are a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in-person. It excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, or town hall meetings.

Under these circumstances, is it accurate to say that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This will be deemed "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as verified by official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documents, or reputable media sources. It will be considered "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden engage in a direct interview exceeding 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024, will Donald Trump be barred or stopped from being listed on the primary election ballot for any U.S. state for a federal role as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Consider this scenario to be true: Joe Biden takes part in a direct interview or on-camera conversation lasting longer than 45 minutes before July 31, 2024. This includes appearances on podcasts, late-night talk shows, or segments incorporated into programs such as 60 Minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed face-to-face. It does not cover press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising activities, or town hall gatherings.

Given these conditions, can it be stated that Donald Trump will be barred or prevented from being listed on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? A response of "Yes" will be given if, by July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially barred or prevented from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as confirmed by official announcements from state governments, court decisions, legal documents, or trustworthy media outlets. A response of "No" will apply if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and (2) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(1) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, excluding press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. The interview must be released before the end of July 2024. Qualifying appearances include podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. 

(2) Donald Trump must be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice. The resolution does not account for legal battles, appeals, or reversals after July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following take place: (1) Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, and (2) Donald Trump is either removed or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden needs to engage in a direct interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, not counting press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. The interview must be made public before the end of July 2024. Acceptable formats include podcasts, late-night television shows, or programs like 60 Minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person. 

(2) Donald Trump must be formally removed or prohibited from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be acceptable. The outcome does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or reversals that may occur after July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (1) Joe Biden engages in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024, and (2) Donald Trump is either removed or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden is required to participate in an in-person interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, not including press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. This interview must be made public prior to the end of July 2024. Acceptable formats include podcasts, late-night television shows, or programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden in an in-person interview. 

(2) Donald Trump must be officially barred or removed from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (such as President, Senate, or House of Representatives) in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. Verification must come from official announcements by state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate. The outcome does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or reversals that may occur after July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that both of the following events will occur: (1) Joe Biden participates in a live interview or discussion on camera lasting more than 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, and (2) Donald Trump is either disqualified or barred from being on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden must take part in a face-to-face interview for no less than 45 minutes, excluding press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. This interview has to be made public before the close of July 2024. Acceptable formats include podcasts, late-night talk shows, or programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of fresh footage featuring Biden in a direct interview. 

(2) Donald Trump must be formally prohibited or removed from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (such as President, Senate, or House of Representatives) in line with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. Confirmation must come from official announcements by state governments, judicial decisions, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative information, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not suffice. The result does not take into account any legal challenges, appeals, or reversals that may take place after July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.body:

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Resolves “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the lead that Donald Trump has over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed in the chart for the date July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the gap between Trump and Biden in 538's national polling average exceed 2 but not surpass 3?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in 538's national polling average between Trump and Biden be greater than 2 but less than 3?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved based on the degree of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when assessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number indicates a Trump lead, while a negative number suggests Biden is in front. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Given Trump leads Biden by more than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

Resolution criteria for this condition: A positive value in the polling average indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. The specific range for this question is a Trump lead greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points.

Then, is the following true: Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Resolution criteria for this outcome: This resolves as YES if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee. All other outcomes resolve as NO, regardless of who receives the nomination on election day.

para_P.title: If Trump is ahead of Biden by over 2 but at most 3 points on July 15, 2024, will Asa Hutchinson be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead of more than 2 and at most 3 points over Joe Biden according to the national polling average from 538, as cited by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

The criteria for determining this condition: A positive polling average indicates Trump is leading, while a negative one indicates Biden is in the lead. The specific range for consideration here is a Trump lead greater than 2 and at most 3 points.

Then, is it accurate to say that Asa Hutchinson is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

The criteria for this result: This will be marked as YES if Asa Hutchinson is chosen by the Republican National Convention delegates as the nominee. Any other outcomes will be marked as NO, regardless of who is nominated on the election day.

para_P.title: If Trump has a lead over Biden that is more than 2 but at most 3 points on July 15, 2024, will Asa Hutchinson be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: On July 15, 2024, the national polling average from 538 indicates that Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden by more than 2 points but no more than 3 points, as noted by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

Criteria for determining this situation: A positive polling average reflects a lead for Trump, while a negative one signifies a lead for Biden. The specific criteria for this question is a Trump lead that is greater than 2 and at most 3 points.

Consequently, is it accurate to say: Asa Hutchinson is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Criteria for determining this result: This will be marked as YES if Asa Hutchinson is nominated by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. Any other result will be marked as NO, regardless of who is nominated on election day.

para_P.title: Should Trump be ahead of Biden by over 2 but no more than 3 points on July 15, 2024, will Asa Hutchinson be the selected Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Given the following scenario: On July 15, 2024, the national polling average from 538 shows that Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden by more than 2 points but not exceeding 3 points, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

The criteria for assessing this situation: A positive polling average indicates a Trump lead, while a negative one indicates a Biden lead. The specific condition for this inquiry is a Trump lead that is greater than 2 and at most 3 points.

Thus, can it be said: Asa Hutchinson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
